job.title: Principal Member of Technical Staff, Analytics Security & Compliance
job.body:
Principal Member of Technical Staff, Analytics Security & Compliance-200011NB

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

Who are we?

Oracle Analytics organization plays a critical role in delivering and supporting best-of-breed cloud solutions to Oracle customers.

The Service Excellence team at Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) is on the verge of transforming the development paradigms at the 42 year old software giant. With the world moving towards the Cloud, Oracle is at the forefront with tremendous portfolio of Cloud offerings.

However, this transformation happens not just at the product level, but also the process of developing, deploying, and operating these products in the Cloud. Using a combination of cutting-edge technologies, continuous process improvements and innovative business transformation methodologies, a small group of us are blazing the trail on the Service Excellence philosophy.

About the Job / The Role

The Service Excellence CSI (Compliance, Security and Inventory) team is seeking experienced engineer who will be responsible for driving Compliance Audit, assessment, risks and tabletop exercises by automating compliance work for our Analytical cloud services implementing near real time compliance monitoring, supporting with Self-service Reports and Dashboards.

As an engineer, you will work with development, product, operations and Compliance teams within Analytical Organization and wider Oracle organizations and to solve interesting technical challenges by self-driving, defining, designing, deploying and troubleshooting key Oracle Cloud services, platforms, and infrastructure, always thinking about reliability, scalability, resilience, security, Compliance, performance and automation.

What You'll Do

  • Partnering with the Compliance teams to ensure the security and compliance of Oracle Analytics team follows regulations, policy, standards, and best practices.
  • As engineer you will assist Service teams through assessment, audit or certification. They will also support compliance operations and continuous monitoring of cloud-based security infrastructure, and support customer compliance inquiries.
  • Candidates will be expected to successfully lead, manage and key focus is to automate audit program portfolio for SOC, Healthcare, BSI27001, SOX, FedRAMP, to support and maintain existing audit compliance efforts and regulatory compliance obligations, and to support program improvements and opportunities, to reduce taxing of org resources.
  • You will perform development activities which would support Compliance work to drive automation controls testing for Audits, risk assessments, Privacy reviews and service pre/post go live.
  • Develop scripts to extract data from Cloud environments to support the controls testing automation.
  • Develop custom tools using Node.JS, Python, Docker and integrating with our existing internal development tools (i.e. Git, Jira, Jenkins, Chef) to support controls testing.
  • Develop, automate and maintain audit/compliance tasks in JIRA and related tools.
  • Build and maintain compliance dashboards to provide a holistic view of the compliance posture of the organization, with self-service validation on compliance work.
  • Develop and maintain Compliance Intranet, Wiki and other portals Assist in Compliance testing as and when required Collaborate and co-ordinate activities.
  • You will understand the end-to-end configuration, technical dependencies, and overall behavioral characteristics of the production services to automate compliance requirements.
  • In partnership with your Development, Product, Security and operations partners, you will have the responsibility to ensure that services have ability to self-service to validate compliant or not and where not, we have designed and provided tooling, reports and dashboards to drive remediation work.
  • Automation – You will have a clear understanding of automation and orchestration principles, and will be eager to automate, wherever and whenever the possibility arises, while simultaneously eliminating technical debt. Automation must be part of your DNA.
  • Technical Experts - As service owner, you are the ultimate escalation point for complex or critical issues that have not yet been documented as SOPs for Level1 staff. You will usually get called in during incidents as an SME, when the source of a problem will relate to Compliance. You will have the deep understanding of service topology and their dependencies required to troubleshoot issues and define mitigations.
  • Evaluates the effectiveness of the internal controls, business processes, and corresponding evidence, in alignment with industry and regulatory requirements and expectations
  • Creates and complete projects to assist in improving organizational efficiency and effectiveness, and minimize organizational impact and risk
  • Conduct business process reviews to both assess the efficiency and effectiveness of operations / service teams as well as evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls
  • Conduct interactions with Service / control owners that exhibits control understanding and confidence
  • Effectively communicate audit status to executive leadership within self-service reporting/dashboards
  • Communicates within the team autonomously and drives the communications across partner teams
  • Drives clearly defined intra-team issues to resolution
  • Learns actively and quickly; empowered to update and enhance current audit processes, tooling, and documentation
  • Evaluates and provides reasonable assurance that risk management, control requirements, and governance systems are functioning as intended and will enable the organization’s objectives and goals to be met
  • Maintains open communication with management and teams across Oracle

What You Need to Have

General Qualifications

The candidate must have knowledge and experience with: (minimum 5+ years’ experience in)

  • Hands on experience with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and/or AWS, Azure, or GCP compute, storage, and network operational experience.
  • Methodical approaches to troubleshooting and solving complex technical problems
  • Issue tracking and collaboration (Jira and Confluence).
  • Producing documentation in support of developed work (KBs, run books, help guides).
  • Linux/Unix system administration including system level knowledge of Linux on OCI Gen 2, creating and executing scripts.
  • Networking and TCP/IP fundamentals.
  • Utilizing agile methodologies.
  • Working with remote, global teams as well as individuals.
  • Ability to effectively assess and communicate risks and appropriate levels of urgency to management and engineering staff
  • Working independently and in a self-directed manner.
  • Most importantly, the aptitude to be a good team player and the willingness to learn and implement new
  • Methodical approach to troubleshooting complex problems
  • Analytical, data science and UI experience
  • Significant experience in control assessment and audit for operational controls
  • In-depth knowledge of industry and regulatory compliance standards
  • Possesses ability to explain complex topics to audiences with no auditing experience
  • Demonstrated ability to use multiple avenues of communication (verbal, written, ticketing, messaging, etc.)
  • Ability to prioritize, manage, and deliver on multiple tasks simultaneously and ability to partner with management in support of key initiatives and projects
  • Motivated to accomplish goals and objectives to ensure organizational and customer success
  • Attention to detail, proven analytical and problem-solving skills

Experience and Education

  • A BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent
  • Strong application/product/software background
  • Understand internet networking services, such as DNS, HTTP, etc.
  • Programming and scripting languages (Perl, Python, Java, bash, Go is our preferred)
  • Using CI/CD scripting tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
  • Containers and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience on Database Administration/Development on Oracle Database, MySQL or other RDBMS
  • Experience in OSQUERY, or other Compliance, Security, Inventory software services.
  • Development in languages, such as Java, bash, Golang
  • Databases and big data stores
  • Defining and documenting technical architecture of complex and highly scalable products
  • Experience with Splunk and dash boarding tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Oracle Analytics Cloud
  • Experience with designing, building, and maintaining APIs
  • Preferred 5-7 years relevant experience working on SOC 2, FedRAMP, HIPAA (or other Healthcare), PCI, BSI27001 Compliance frameworks

Expected Oracle tasks:

  • Significant experience in control assessment and audit for operational controls
  • In-depth knowledge of industry and regulatory compliance standards
  • Proven ability to combine business acumen, technical acumen, and process expertise to assess requirements and alignment
  • Possesses ability to explain complex topics to audiences with no auditing experience
  • Demonstrated ability to use multiple avenues of communication (verbal, written, ticketing, messaging, etc.)
  • Ability to prioritize, manage, and deliver on multiple tasks simultaneously and ability to partner with management in support of key initiatives and projects
  • Motivated to accomplish goals and objectives to ensure organizational and customer success
  • Attention to detail, proven analytical and problem-solving skills

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.


Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems.

Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.

job.title: Lumin Digital Sr. Software Engineer
job.body:
Join the people helping people.

For people drawn to serving others through their work, PSCU is a place to thrive, as we serve our credit union members best by taking care of each other first.

If you want to help shape an industry, challenge yourself, and invest in your own future, this is the place for you. PSCU is a highly accessible environment where you’re empowered to think on your feet, work from your heart, and discover the very best version of your professional and personal self. “Our Momentum. Your Moment.”

This application is the first step in seizing your moment.

Join our group of passionate software engineers developing cloud-based web applications using the latest technologies. The best candidates will have a love of technology and a drive to improve developer productivity through automation. We work closely with our product owners in an exciting and interactive agile development environment.

All Engineers are expected to be engaged throughout the full life cycle of the product including architecting, developing, documenting, troubleshooting, supporting, bug fixing, and more. The product is being developed in a microservice architecture using Node.js and TypeScript on the server side. This API will be accessed from an Angular client, smart phone apps, and various other systems. Our engineers can work on any or all of these pieces as needed which is a constant opportunity for learning.

We need Software Engineers that:

  • Have hands on experience working with large web applications
  • Know the value of modularity and keeping it simple
  • Use object oriented programming practices
  • Feel comfortable with relational databases
  • Love working as part of a strong team
  • Want to keep up on the latest technologies and drive innovation
  • Enjoy working in an interactive, agile environment

Typically we find it takes a college degree plus 8 or more years of experience to get all this dialed in but, if you feel like you have what we need, don’t let that hold you back.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.body:
Emplify has a strong commitment to principles of diversity and seeks a broad spectrum of candidates including women, minorities, and persons with disabilities

What we're doing at Emplify:

Our team understands the real challenges that everyday people and their organizations face. And while we're a software company that lives and breathes data and analytics, we know humans aren't just ones and zeros — we see the real people behind the data.

Our employee engagement measurement platform fuses survey technology and proven methodology with human strategists, to identify the specific actions business leaders and managers can take to continually improve employee engagement and performance. We help create engaged workforces, giving each employee a reason to invest their full heart and mind in their work. It's the true calling of leaders, and the journey of Emplify: To create thriving cultures in which people can do the best work of their lives.

What you'll be doing as part of the team:

As a Software Engineer at Emplify, you will build and deliver the software platforms that power our product and allow people to achieve their true potential at work. Ranging from the Insights platform and other customer-facing products to tools used by our Customer Success team to enhance their interactions with customers, engineers build the technology to improve our customer experience. Our software engineers strive to effectively deliver solutions that solve our business problems in a performant and technically excellent manner.

A day in the life of a Software Engineer:

We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push engagement forward.

  • Coordinate with our product partners and your peers to determine daily and weekly priorities
  • Design, implement, test, deploy and document applications on a variety of platforms
  • Gather and analyze requirements from customers and domain experts
  • Design and analyze solutions, including domain modeling and design patterns
  • Participate in code inspections, reviews and other activities to ensure quality
  • In partnership with the Product team, participate in the backlog refinement process to decomposes larger-scale initiatives into units of work with defined acceptance criteria

You'll know if you're successful if you:

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software with limited supervision
  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables successfully
  • Participate in full software development lifecycle (SDLC)
  • Actively engage as a member of a high performance, agile team
  • Have strong opinions about software development but openness to change your mind through collaboration
  • Deliver quality work product that meets acceptance criteria and functions as expected
  • Contribute to a codebase with clear standards for syntax and approach
  • Help to deliver a solution that is optimized along standards of performance overall solution cost
  • Delight our customers with a polished user experience that enhances their overall relationship with our product and with Emplify.

What you'll bring to the table:

  • 1+ years of general web or platform development experience with web technologies
  • 2+ years experience with Javascript frameworks
  • Strong knowledge of object-oriented design principles and methodologies.
  • Experience building on AWS or other cloud solutions is a plus
  • You've used Node, React or other progressive JavaScript frameworks to build dependable and scalable services
  • You have experience with one of the following tools:
    • Github
    • Jenkins or other CI/CD tool
    • PostgreSQL or other RDBMS
    • DynamoDB or other NoSQL/Document DB
  • You have strong communication skills; both written and oral
  • You're a self starter who is excited about the fast pace of a growing, changing startup environment
  • You must be continually striving to grow and challenge yourself to achieve your wildest goals - always pushing to the very edge of what you think you're capable of
  • You must have an innate drive for excellence and mastery of your craft, fueled by intellectual curiosity
  • You must have the courage, passion, and tenacity to relentlessly pursue our mission
  • You must have a tolerance for change. Learning and throwing away ideas that fail early is key to our fast paced success, so agility and flexibility is critical for this role

Why you'll love working at Emplify

  • We hire only exceptional talent, you'll be joining a world-class team
  • We are rapidly growing, we provide equity to all team members
  • We care about your total wellness, we offer a 401(k) plan w/ a generous matching contribution as well as comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans
  • We understand the importance of family and time to recharge, we provide parental leave benefits, unlimited PTO, and remote flexibility
  • We want you to have the tools you need, we provide a monthly technology stipend
  • We are invested in your growth, we provide an annual professional development budget
  • We want every team member to engage in our culture, we have a weekly catered lunch, several affinity groups, and plenty of space for radical collaboration

Why you'll want to be a part of our story:

We're all-in to help people achieve their true potential at work. We're relentlessly pursuing growth and development. We strive to be extraordinary, fueled by a commitment to the mastery of our craft. We show courage through communicating candidly and sharing bold ideas. We relentlessly envision a brighter future. We are an inclusive, trusting, and caring community. We are Emplify, and we help create thriving cultures in which people can do the best work of their lives.

Inclusion Promise: Emplify embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are relentlessly committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the more our culture comes to life, and the better we can fulfill our purpose of helping people achieve their true potential at work.

Location: This position can be fully remote; however, occasional travel for professional development and/or training will be expected when it is safe to do so.

Who We Are

Tavour makes it possible to discover and access the highest-rated craft beers from all over the nation through our mobile app experience. We believe deeply in our mission to support independent brewers, bringing innovation and access centerstage for over 600 independent breweries and counting. We equip ourselves with bold, ambitious, and innovative thinkers to take on every challenge as a new opportunity. And yes, you could say we like beer.

Since our start in 2013, we have grown into an already profitable 8-figure startup that is reshaping an industry worth over $26B. We are looking for a Software Developer who is excited to take on engineering challenges to join us on our way to $100M+ in the next three years. This is a rare opportunity to join the early stage of an already profitable company.


What We’re Looking For

We are seeking an experienced, talented full-stack Engineer to join the engineering team at Tavour in Seattle (or remotely). The right fit for this position is looking to tackle new engineering challenges at a company where your role has a direct and measurable high impact on the company’s growth. You are eager to design and build new features and products that are highly scalable. You are passionate about building the best solutions in a data-driven culture where we test everything and ground ourselves in every decision.


You will get to...

  • Architect, design and develop new web & mobile applications, tools, and services for Tavour ecosystem in Ruby on Rails, Node.js, React, React Native, MySQL, and many others.

  • Create, improve, and refine workflows and processes for delivering quality software on time and without incurring technical debt.
  • Work closely with Tavour product managers, visual designers, customer support representatives, and account managers to help the business move fast and efficiently through relentless automation.

You will do it by...

You will love it because…

In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes health, medical, and vision insurance, equity participation, an employer-matched 401(k) plan, paid time off, paid maternity leave, fitness membership reimbursement, and commuter/parking reimbursement.

To Apply

job.title: Front End Engineer
job.body:
About EAB

At EAB, our mission is to make education smarter and our communities stronger. We harness the collective power of more than 1,900 schools, colleges, and universities to uncover and apply proven practices and transformative insights. And since complex problems require multifaceted solutions, we work with each school differently to apply these insights through a customized blend of research, technology, and services. From kindergarten to college and beyond, EAB partners with education leaders, practitioners, and staff to accelerate progress and drive results across three key areas: enrollment management, student success, and institutional operations and strategy.

At EAB, we serve not only our partner institutions but each other—that's why we are always working to make sure our employees love their jobs and are invested in their community. See how we've been recognized for this dedication to our employees by checking out our recent awards.

For more information, visit our Careers page.

The Role in Brief:

Front End Engineer

Seeking a Font-end Engineer to solve deep problems with a platform-wide User Interface platform for rapid application development. The role involves supporting the development of a new programming language and the components it uses to construct interfaces.

This position is open to remote work or can be based in our Birmingham, AL office.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Aid in the development of solutions that support consistent information architecture, taxonomies, visual standards, interaction patterns, and use cases across multiple applications
  • Self-start and steward your implementations through the software development process ensuring you champion the standards of the UX team in every development challenge
  • Follow common sustainable page design, management, and development methodologies
  • Perform testing at the page & source for presentation layer defects
  • Writing HTML5 Web Components
  • Writing in Typescript to solve deep software language and classical computer science problems
  • Developing accessible solutions across the platform

Basic Qualifications:

  • Passion for making dynamic, performant, enterprise web applications
  • 2 years of front-end engineer experience
  • Technical college degree
  • Understanding of SDLC and the technical and business challenges that come with development of a product
  • This position will be a busy one. Self-drive and a desire to work hard, cranking through a backlog.
  • Thorough, methodical, problem solver and creative with extreme attention to detail
  • Knowledge of and ability to discuss HTML5, CSS, JavaScript solutions
  • Extremely strong verbal and written communication skills. This role must easily be able to have clear communication over email, IM, phone, and in person.
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Expert at time management as well as working & finding answers to questions independently

Ideal Qualifications:

  • Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Typescript, Polymer/LitElement, modern JS framework (VueJS, Angular, React, etc.)
  • Experience with traditional software patterns and application architecture
  • Experience with a broad range of HTML5 API’s
  • Experience developing with accessibility standards in mind
  • Experience with object-oriented, functional, logic, and imperative programming
  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, User Experience, or a related field.

Benefits:

Consistent with our belief that our employees are our most valuable resource, EAB offers a competitive and inclusive benefits package.

  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance; dependents and domestic partners eligible
  • 401(k) retirement plan with company match
  • 20+ days of PTO annually, in addition to paid firm holidays
  • Daytime leave policy for community service or fitness activities (up to 10 hours a month each)
  • Paid parental leave for birthing or non-birthing parents
  • Phase Back to Work program for employees returning from parental leave
  • Infertility treatment coverage and adoption or surrogacy assistance
  • Wellness programs including gym discounts and incentives to promote healthy living
  • Dynamic growth opportunities with merit-based promotion philosophy
  • Benefits kick in day one, see the full details here.

At EAB, we believe that to fulfill our mission to “make education smarter and our communities stronger” we need team members who bring a diversity of perspectives to the table and a workplace where each team member is valued, respected and heard.

To that end, EAB is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we make employment decisions on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

job.body:
About the position: Motional is looking for a Senior Product Designer to help us deliver a user experience that is intuitive, comfortable, user-centered, and that will develop trust for this state-of-the-art technology. You’ll be on a small, fast-paced agile team, collaborating with other Product Designers, Industrial Designers, User Researchers, Product Managers, and Engineers.

In the short term you’ll help move forward the UI design of our user experience, including design of mobile applications and integrated HMI systems (i.e. sound, lighting, physical buttons). Longer term, other opportunities for design are possible, including design of driving behavior, fleet management software, next generation vehicles, etc.

Please submit your resume, and an online or PDF portfolio with at least 3 projects that best represent your capabilities, skills and interests.

What you'll do

  • Lead collaborative team sessions such as brainstorming with a project team
  • Work with user researchers to drive understanding of key user needs, problems, desires, and personas
  • Lead UX deliverables including user flows, wireframes, prototypes, etc.
  • Deliver polished, pixel perfect UI Design artifacts
  • Work with product managers to define goals and focus work
  • Plan and lead large complex design initiatives
  • Work with engineers to implement designs you create, ensuring quality
  • Support researchers in user testing sessions
  • Help define how users will interact with the future of autonomous vehicles!

What you'll bring

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Graphic Design, UX Design, or similar
  • Ability to lead major design initiatives with little guidance
  • 5-10 years of hands on experience in an in house design team or consulting/design agency
  • Experience with planning large workstreams, meeting measurable goals and deadlines
  • Strong experience in all stages of the design process, from early strategy and ideation, wireframes and prototypes, to the final implementation of UI design.
  • Strong cross-platform design experience, particularly in mobile app design (not just web)
  • Experience working closely with engineers in an agile development process
  • Experience taking feedback from users, and iterating on design
  • Solid grasp on user interaction and animation principles
  • The ability to be flexible and inventive, using non-traditional approaches and techniques to design, given our product space
  • Experience with industry standard design tools, such as Sketch, Zeplin, and the Adobe Creative Suite.

Bonus Experience

  • Extensive knowledge of accessibility, such as work tailored to meet those needs
  • Experience creating UI guidelines
  • Animation experience (beyond basic UI animation)
  • Physical>Digital experience (exhibits, LEDs, physical installations, TVs, AVs!
  • Sound design/effects
  • Experience with any sort of programming (i.e. JS/CSS)
  • Experience working on autonomous vehicles

What we offer

  • Interesting work defining the user experience for autonomous vehicles
  • Mostly remote schedule, occasionally going on site to see vehicles when needed
  • Flexible working hours (occasional late night/early morning meetings with overseas engineering teams)

About Us
Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.
Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry’s largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world’s first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world’s most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group, one of the world’s largest vehicle manufacturers offering smart mobility solutions, and Aptiv, a global technology leader in advanced safety, electrification, and vehicle connectivity, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.

Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the US and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

job.title: Product Manager
job.body:
Full-time, Boston, MA or US Remote (East Coast)

Hurry up! We’ve got a dream to build!

BlueConic is an international start-up that’s growing fast. We love what we do, we’re proud of how we do it, and we’ve teamed up to create a truly exceptional product and company. BlueConic is a leader in the white-hot customer data platform space and it’s our job to make sure every marketer gets in on the fun. Are you the type of product manager that wants to set the bar for achievement at a fast-growing start-up in one of the hottest SaaS markets? Does getting in on the ground floor and helping drive the company’s early success get you excited? Are you motivated by playing a critical role in building the future of the company?

We’ve got a job for you.

We’re looking for the next rock start to join the BlueCrew and we need a motivated Product Manager who will be responsible for our product and its implementation from start to finish. Together with members of the management team and the product owners of our scrum teams, you will manage the roadmap and backlog and collaborate with all stakeholders – customers, prospects, analysts, and partners – to deeply understand our target market and buyer’s needs. You are responsible for all aspects of the product roadmap.

You will work on a daily basis with BlueConic’s highly experienced development team. The incredible success of our software product is largely due to the vision and the implementation of the technology, as well as its timeliness to market. You’re a fit if you are passionate about marketing, architecture, and technology. You are patient and exceptionally smart, have an eye for details, disciplined and are a great communicator. A sense of humor and an enthusiasm for participating in discussions about random things on Slack are also a must.

Responsibilities include:

  • Help define, manage, and execute the product roadmap by executing the day-to-day management, planning, and backlog of a selected group of end-to-end features and capabilities.
  • Coordinate the priority of backlog and roadmap items, future capabilities, and updates.
  • Work closely with the Product Owners and UX engineers to scope and translate roadmap items into user stories and detailed product feature specifications to hand over to the development teams.
  • Own the predictability of roadmap delivery, including, as needed, managing conflict resolution between teams and leadership, as well as recommending opportunities to improve the responsiveness, accuracy, and effectiveness of the teams.
  • Collect and synthesize relevant information for the roadmap including interacting with customers, prospects, partners to explain the roadmap and gather feedback and input for future capabilities; staying on top of competitor and market trends; and collaborating with internal stakeholders (e.g. marketing, sales, and customer success) to get their input on the roadmap.
  • Act as the translator between Product and the rest of the business by working together with product and company leadership to translate our vision to the best CDP in the market; serving as a resource to teams about the company and product vision; and articulating business objectives to guide requirements and design of new features and capabilities
  • Work closely with go-to-market teams, product, and company leadership to document, prepare, coordinate, and communicate the releases of new features and capabilities both functionally as well as non-functionally, as well as resent and communicate the product vision and roadmap externally in whole or in part as required for prospects, customers, analysts, etc.

We are looking for someone with the following skills:

  • A background in computer science and a technical bachelor’s degree is strongly preferred
  • Technical proficiency with marketing technology, advertising technology, and/or customer analytics
  • Deeply familiar with Web and mobile technologies like HTML, JavaScript, Node.js, big data, Android, iOS, Java
  • 3-5 years of experience as an Enterprise SaaS software product manager or product owner
    Hands-on experience with Scrum and Agile methodologies
  • Impeccable organizational and time management skills
  • Superlative communication skills, especially with global, diverse teams, in writing, in virtual meetings, in doc

You will be a great fit if you:

  • Are eager to drive the creation the best marketing technology product in the world
  • Are a strong team player with a “can do” attitude
  • Are passionate, enthusiastic, and eager to learn
  • Are equally fascinated with all things technical and by software design
  • Are located in the Netherlands or on the East coast, and are able to safely travel ~25% of the time
  • Understand these pages in 1 reading:
    • https://support.blueconic.com/hc/en-us/articles/200449801-Content-flickering
    • https://support.blueconic.com/hc/en-us/articles/202532082-Universal-Analytics-Connection
    • https://support.blueconic.com/hc/en-us/articles/200471782-How-does-profile-merging-work
  • Are deeply intrigued by this page: https://support.blueconic.com/hc/en-us/articles/202528082-BlueConic-REST-API
  • Nod your head all the time when reading https://www.khoslaventures.com/wp-content/uploads/Good_Product_Manager_Bad_Product_Manager_KV.pdf
  • Have a mind for asking questions and synthesizing information that drives results
  • Don’t ever think “good enough” is good enough
  • Do enjoy going into the nitty gritty details if necessary, but still see the big picture
  • See patience as a virtue

Reasons to join us:

  • Be part of a dynamic and professional, very seasoned team (most of the engineering team has more than 10 years of experience)
  • Take advantage of great opportunities for career progression
  • You want to work with the very latest tools and tech

job.title: Senior Full-stack Software Engineer (Remote)
job.body:
About Collage.com

Collage.com's mission is to make the creation of custom products easy for everyone, by providing exceptional software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show, The View, and Good Morning America many times. We are a 100% employee-owned company.

We are 100% Remote

As a 100% remote company, we are set up to provide the best possible environment for engineering. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes, inefficient systems, and commuting, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. Collage.com's co-founders/co-CEOs both come from a technical background and believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we're a start-up), use continuous deployment (code goes straight to production after each merge), and are in the process of adopting mobx-state-tree with React. Strong engineering is a key part of our business strategy - it lets us build best-in-class design tools faster than our larger competitors.

The Role

We are seeking an enthusiastic and nice senior full-stack engineer who shares our passion for building a great software company. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on our engineering team's growth by helping us continually raise the bar. You will be expected to collaborate with other engineers to solve complex technical problems and push us to deliver higher quality code at an ever-increasing rate. We firmly believe in the power of solid architecture, code design, and simplicity. If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you.

Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com.

Responsibilities

  • Write and maintain front-end JavaScript code as part of a mobile-first web application, including UI components and state management logic, as well as back-end PHP and front-end network communication code (back end is approximately 10% of work).
  • Make decisions about code design, architecture, and refactoring to balance technical debt against delivering functionality.
  • Plan and lead testing for complex projects.
  • Review code and mentor other engineers.
  • Provide time estimates and participate in agile development.
  • Review specifications and work with PMs to implement lean methodology.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience implementing and testing advanced JavaScript code on a team as part of a production web or mobile application
  • Practical experience with MV* architecture (such as Backbone, Vue, React + Redux/Mobx, etc.), unidirectional data flow, and minimal class/object interfaces
  • Spatial/geometric reasoning ability - for rendering, animation, and image manipulation
  • Ability to quickly understand and work with unfamiliar complex code
  • Proactive and clear communication is essential for this remote work position

Benefits and Perks

  • Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com.)
  • 401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family.
  • Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan.
  • Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it).
  • We'll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.

The Interview Process

The goal of our interview process is to identify people who will be a good fit for our company and are talented, motivated engineers. Because you will be working remotely, all of our interviews are done remotely. We look for candidates with good written and verbal communication skills who embody our company values (which can be found on our careers page).

During the interview process, you will:

  • Speak to a member of our talent acquisition team which will be mostly an experience and values/culture fit assessment
  • Complete a shorter coding task that includes questions in Javascript and focuses on applying general programming concepts (like concurrency and good code structure) in realistic scenarios
  • Speak with a senior member of our engineering team
  • Complete a more complex technical assessment that is intended to emulate your actual work environment
  • Speak with our VP of engineering and both founders/CEOs of the company

We believe in transparency, and will give you the opportunity to speak with anyone else you'd like to meet before accepting an offer. You are making an important choice, and we want to make sure you are fully committed to joining our team.

Job details

Full-time

Full Job Description

Getlabs provides safe and easy at-home lab appointments. Rather than needing to go to a laboratory and sit in a waiting room, patients just pick a time and we send a phlebotomist to draw their samples. Once collected, we deliver to top national laboratories including LabCorp and Quest Diagnostics.

Across healthcare, the stress and inconvenience of needing to go to medical facilities deters patients from following through with medical appointments. That is why our mission is to create the infrastructure and network for high-quality mobile care. We believe all patients - regardless of their means - deserve access to medical appointments in the convenience of their homes. Join us and let’s transform the healthcare experience to be delightful for patients.

Our team has extensive domain expertise in technology, operations, and phlebotomy with team members from Y Combinator, Uber, Sonder, Cisco Systems, LabCorp, and Quest Diagnostics. Getlabs is backed by prominent venture capital firms including PivotNorth, Liquid 2, Tusk, Rosecliff, and more.

We are currently seeking a full-time Senior Full Stack Engineer interested in joining a growth stage startup.

Above all, we are seeking candidates who are self-starters and are resourceful, organized, detail-oriented, communicative, and friendly. As a core team member, you will be responsible for working on new products and features across multiple domains and technologies. The ability to weigh in on architecture and strategic product decisions, as well as critically thinking about and advocating for product enhancements and optimizations is a must. You will be working with the following technologies: Typescript, Node.js, Angular, Nest.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, Message Queues, Kubernetes, Terraform, and GCP/AWS.

At Getlabs, you will:

  • Design and develop high quality and scalable front-end (Angular 8+) and back-end (Node.js) applications, and deploy it all on GCP or AWS
  • Write structured, tested, readable, and maintainable code
  • Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distributed knowledge
  • Perform profiling, debugging, and performance tuning of Javascript based applications
  • Stay current with the latest front-end and back-end technologies, best practices, and sharing your findings with the rest of the team
  • Contribute to each step of the development process (from ideation, to implementation and release)
  • Work as part of an agile team across multiple application domains and technologies
  • Evolve our application stack and mentoring other team members on development patterns and best practices
  • Interact at a high level with different stakeholders: architects, team leads, managers, documentation, etc

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 3+ years of industry experience with full stack architecture and distributed systems including hands-on experience with Angular and Node.js
  • Excellent Typescript, SCSS, and HTML skills
  • Expertise with cloud infrastructure and automated infrastructure management on services such as GCP and AWS
  • Ability to take designer-created assets as well as quick mockups and implement them from start to finish
  • Experience working in a fast paced startup environment with quick iteration, continuous deployment, and test-driven development
  • Passion for using technology to improve the lives of our customers
  • Excitement for solving tough problems that haven’t been solved before
  • Desire to work in a collaborative environment with a tight knit team of passionate people
  • Knowledge of HIPAA/ePHI compliance

We have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:

  • Competitive salary
  • Valuable stock option plan
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance options (United States Only)
  • Flexible and unlimited vacation
  • A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of talented, ambitious and fun-to-work-with colleagues!
This is a remote position that requires you to live in the United States or Canada. If you live in Canada, this will be a contract position. This will be a full-time employee in the United States. The engineering headquarters are in Los Angeles and Toronto and you may be asked to travel for meetings to these offices.

Getlabs is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected classes.

job.body:
Front End Software Engineer

<br>

Job Description

<br>

Front-End Developer – STR - Hendersonville

OVERVIEW

STR was acquired in October 2019 as a division of CoStar Group, Inc., the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics and online marketplaces. STR is in the process of combining CoStar’s largest and most up-to-date properties database with STR’s global hospitality performance data, to give both real estate and hospitality customers a unique and powerful combined view of their local markets.

The Applications Services team works with the CoStar Analytics team to develop customer-facing Hospitality benchmarking products. We think big; creating innovative data-intensive applications that take the vast amount of data collected from STR clients and by the CoStar Research teams to create a fast, reliable and intuitive analytics platform for customers. We are a collaborative group with a mix of big data, API/platform and front-end skills, and we are growing rapidly to help invent the future of Hospitality benchmarking and analytics.

We are searching for a Front-End Developer to join our Hendersonville team and drive the full-lifecycle development of these critical products.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designing, building, testing and deploying scalable, reusable and maintainable applications that handle large amounts of data with a good understanding of design patterns, and modern architectural trends.
  • Taking ownership of your work, from development and testing, to eventual deployment and support in production.
  • Collaborating with other engineers, product owners, designers, and leadership using agile development practices.
  • Becoming a trusted team member in matters of technical architecture, design, and code.
  • Advocating for evolution and improvement - both technical and non-technical - within our teams. Includes new tech, tools and best practices.
  • Gain a deep understanding of the CoStar and STR company business rules and methodology.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science/Engineering.
  • 3+ years of professional software development experience.
  • Deep knowledge of modern JavaScript.
  • Deep knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and CSS preprocessors.
  • Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving abilities.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

  • Expertise with Source Control, such as Git or TFS.
  • Expertise with Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure is a plus.
  • Experience with React, TypeScript, Webpack, and NodeJS a big plus
  • Experience with testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, and Chai

OVERVIEW OF COMPANY:

Founded in 1987, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate.

Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over 4,300 worldwide.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:

Working at STR and CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.

Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug
  • Life, legal, and supplementary insurance
  • 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement

Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group:

Senior Software Engineer - Cloud Backend

Company Description

Butterfly Network's mission is to democratize healthcare by making medical imaging accessible to everyone around the world. We are reinventing medical imaging and championing a new era of healthcare by creating the first ever pocket-sized, whole-body ultrasound device - the Butterfly iQ. This breakthrough technology has reduced the cost of the traditional ultrasound system by miniaturizing it onto a single semiconductor silicon chip.

Since inception, Butterfly has raised over $800 million. The Butterfly iQ has received CE Mark and FDA clearance, and is being sold in hospitals and clinics around the globe.

Joining Butterfly Network is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced software engineer to build our critical Enterprise Connectivity systems. The Butterfly Cloud provides a secure and robust connection to private clinical networks. This connectivity enables medical professionals to use both the Butterfly iQ and their existing ultrasound systems with Butterfly Enterprise, an industry leading SaaS platform enabling clinician-to-clinician collaboration, education, and review for ultrasound-centric patient care. Join us in solving challenging, mission critical problems that will make our technology accessible to 40 million physicians and billions of people worldwide.

As part of our team, your core responsibilities will be to:

  • Solve distributed systems problems, designing for elasticity, reliability, performance and automated validation
  • Build modern solutions using the best technologies available, informed by a deep understanding of cloud architecture and how distributed systems operate at scale
  • Own business problems, shape ideas into system designs and lead developers through execution
  • Mentor and lead other engineers to achieve our goals

Qualifications

Baseline skills/experiences/attributes:

  • 5+ years of experience solving distributed systems problems
  • Robust experience designing and building modern back-end cloud systems
  • A track record of leading developers to deliver effective solutions in a modern, cloud-based architecture, ideally using Python and Node.js
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Ideally, you also have skills and experience in these areas (but it's ok if you don't!):

  • GraphQL and related frameworks e.g. Relay, Apollo and URQL
  • Containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS
  • Web apps with live updates - pub/sub solutions (such as Redis), WebSockets

You Deeply Identify with Core Butterfly Network Values:

  • Efficient & Speedy - you get work done in a fraction of the time as industry peers

  • Mission-Driven & Committed - you are passionate about the company's purpose and are immensely productive
  • Team Oriented - you celebrate and take joy in the success of others on the team

Additional Information

We offer great perks:

  • Fully covered medical insurance plan, and dental & vision coverage - as a health-tech company, we place great worth on our teams' well-being
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits - we make your commute more reasonable
  • Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks
  • 401k plan - we facilitate your retirement goals
  • Flexible Paid Time Off - recharge and come back ready to make an impact
  • Beautiful office in Palo Alto or open for remote location
  • Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it
  • Equity - we want every employee to be a stakeholder
  • The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!

For this role, we provide visa assistance for qualified candidates.

Butterfly network does not accept agency resumes.

Butterfly Network Inc. is an E-Verify Company and is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. Job Description:
Overview

As a member of the Cyber Security Engineering & Operations team, you will be responsible for consulting on internal and external enterprise-facing cyber security projects, proposing and designing reasonable cyber security controls, understanding existing cyber security capabilities and keeping up to date on new and emerging solutions. You will also be responsible and accountable for architecting solutions, recommending optimizations of current services, and providing technical leadership across the enterprise to inform and advance our cloud security posture. A successful candidate will possess strong learning agility, keen intellectual integrity, a mature risk mindset and a robust background in automation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Lead the design and implementation of a wide range of cyber security projects.
  • Collaborate with peers in Technology & Solutions to design and implement secure solutions and services.
  • Partner with the business to develop and deploy sustainable cyber security solutions at scale, that reduce cyber security risk for our most critical assets.
  • Self-direct and contribute through cooperative team effort amongst peer groups.
  • Review, critique and provide best practices for improving existing cyber security hardware and software.
  • Partner with other cyber security team members to transition day-to-day activities of deployed solutions and identify and implement automation around routine tasks.
  • Continuously develops knowledge of evolving best practices through peer benchmarking, industry events/associations, and educational opportunities.
  • Leverages partnership and relationships to benchmark existing and proposed cyber security solutions.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Successful track record of positively influencing stakeholders.
    Strong interpersonal, verbal, presentation, and written communication skills
  • A working knowledge of cyber security, cyber security technology, risk assessment and management.
  • Demonstrated ability to work across organizational boundaries, and influence others.
  • Ability to define and manage internal projects and milestones and demonstrated leadership skills.
  • Knowledge in tools and techniques used by attackers to gain unauthorized access to systems.
  • Understands how corporations operate in the global economy and is familiar with operational risk concerns for international businesses.
    Knowledge of security principles and best practices in cloud substrates (GCP, Azure, AWS)
  • In depth understanding of cloud cybersecurity standards, frameworks, and best practices.
  • Experience implementing cloud security monitoring and logging solutions supporting detection & response processes
    Applied knowledge of defensible security architecture and engineering principles.
  • Experience building sustainable, scalable, and efficient security tools and automation using industry standard scripting languages and best practices.
  • Systematic problem-solving approach coupled with a strong focus on continuous improvement.
  • Continually evaluate and optimize cloud security reference architectures and engineering principles.
  • Collaborates to establish multi-cloud cybersecurity architecture with a focus on proactive threat detection, security control enforcement and incident response.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Excellent analytical and conceptual problem-solving skills, especially where there is ambiguity.
  • Prior experience with information security technologies, including boundary protection, endpoint protection, remote access, and security information and event management
  • Working knowledge of Agile Methodologies
  • Strong organizational and project management skills with an ability to manage numerous, competing demands from internal and external stakeholders
  • Ability to influence through relationship building
    Ability to work both independently and in a collaboratively in a team environment
  • Discretion, integrity, and independent sound judgment in both designing and implementing processes
  • Strong analytic skills with a penchant for measuring what matters
  • Strong scripting skills using PowerShell, Python, Node.js, JavaScript, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc.
  • Experience implementing and maintaining network security infrastructure across multi-region and multi-cloud environment
Company Overview:
We exist to make food the world loves. But we do more than that. Our company is a place that prioritizes being a force for good, a place to expand learning, explore new perspectives and reimagine new possibilities, every day. We look for people who want to bring their best — bold thinkers with big hearts who challenge one other and grow together. Because becoming the undisputed leader in food means surrounding ourselves with people who are hungry for what’s next.

job.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer and Team Lead
job.body:
Job details

Job Type
Full-time
Contract

Full Job Description

Come help us change the real estate industry! ProspectNow.com is a venture backed, profitable, high growth company that provides a nationwide database of 8 million commercial building owners to companies that need to contact and market to commercial building owners. We have over a thousand customers including fortune 500 companies as well as commercial real estate agents, lenders, and investors. If you want to be part of an explosive growth and entrepreneurial environment, this is a tremendous opportunity. ProspectNow also has a great working environment and located right downtown in Los Altos. You will be a key player at a fast growing company, you will be challenged and you will have a lot of fun along the way. Come join the ProspectNow Team!

Job Description

This position represents a tremendous opportunity to have a major impact on a fast growing and really cool real estate website called ProspectNow. We are tracking over 100 million properties and provide detailed analytics for the real estate community. If you are the right candidate, you will have an opportunity to help with performance, scalability, and usability. You will report to and work closely with the CEO as well as be a team lead for the other engineers. Our product is built on the LAMP stack and we are currently migrating to AWS elastic bean stalk and RDS. As a part of this migration, we are reviewing frameworks and platforms to further optimize the application.

We have recently implemented SCRUM along with a migration from SVN to Git and bit-bucket. So an understanding of SCRUM and branching etc is a requirement.

Because this is a team lead role (and ultimately could grow into a management position), your ability to communicate and help motivate the team are critical. We are looking for someone with an unbridled passion for software development. This position is in Los Altos, Ca. Remote positions are not being considered at this time however relocation assistance may be provided for the right candidate.

Here are a few examples of engineering situations you would deal with:

  • Importing 10GB fixed with text files into a mysql database efficiently on a weekly basis and then running post processing scripts to calculate and derive new fields from the data. E.g. count the number of properties an owner owns or calculate the average value in a zip code.
  • Aggregate properties from multiple data-sources with different address formats and cross reference by address
  • Calculating analytics from a group of properties on a map enclosed in a series of polygon points dynamically. E.g. display a pie chart of properties by type
  • Build entirely new UI on top of our internal API based on Sketch images using HTML, angular/react.js and CSS.

and any more…

ProspectNow is a profitable and growing enterprise, so we are not dependent on raising more money to continue to do what we do. We are confident we can accelerate from double digit growth to triple digit with the addition of the right features.

This position may be a contract job to start, or we might do a full time role depending on the candidate.

Qualifications

  • Extensive knowledge of AWS
  • Solid understanding of SCRUM and Git
  • Extensive database knowldege including Amazon RDS and databases over 1TB
  • Experience using CSS, HTML5, Linux, PHP, Mysql, JavaScript and familiarity with AngularJS
  • Experience with frameworks including Twitter-bootstrap
  • Experience working with distributed APIs such as google maps
  • Good understanding of indexing tools such as Sphinx and working with large databases.
  • Experience building web applications that are highly optimized for client/server performance
  • Understanding of A/B testing and data driven development
  • Reference-able systems that you have designed, developed and maintained through many development cycles
  • 6+ years experience


Additional Information

Benefits:

Uncapped commissions
401(k), healthcare, vision, life insurance
Convenient office locations in downtown Los Altos, CA and Roseville, CA
Great team!

job.title: Senior Consultant, Application Development
job.body:
Job summary:
Come work for a company relied upon by most fortune 500 companies in the airline, telco, healthcare, and commercial banking businesses. The Red Hat Consulting team is looking for an application development focused Senior Consultant to join us in the U.S. In this role, you will work with customers to design and develop cloud native applications utilizing our Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform and Red Hat Runtimes which includes SpringBoot, Node.js, Vert.x, Quarkus, and more. You won't be expected to know everything on day one, but your ability to learn new languages and technologies quickly will be essential. As a Senior Consultant, you will help us build resilient customer-focused applications that scale to the demands of the modern digital marketplace. By joining our team of experts you will become an industry-leading consultant in full-stack cloud native development who can guide clients through the entire development life cycle including design thinking, continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD), and deployment strategies, to multi-cloud scaling. This is a remote position with potential weekly travel to customer sites which can be located anywhere in the U.S. within close proximity to an airport. Successful applicants must reside in a state where Red Hat is registered to do business.
Primary job responsibilities:
  • Be part of a fast-growing, highly passionate consulting team that is supportive of its members, constantly collaborates on solutions, and strives to facilitate the best use of open source technologies and development approaches to solve real world challenges
  • Participate in practical enablement sessions to be quickly brought up to speed on delivering mission-critical applications to our customers using container, microservices, polyglot languages, and frameworks and design thinking approaches
  • Be responsible for mentoring customers and delivering end-to-end cloud native software development techniques in fast paced, mission critical environments
  • Become highly proficient in developing applications for the Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform that utilizes capabilities like a Service Mesh and Serverless architectures
  • Use design thinking techniques to manage client facing problem solving exercises to handle tough problems in an innovative way
  • Constantly learn about new technologies and apply these concepts to customer needs, present to internal Red Hat team members and external audiences at technical conferences
  • Become a trusted advisor to our customers, helping them achieve business success in an ever-changing technology landscape
  • Work closely with product business, product engineering, support, and sales teams to ensure excellent customer experience with Red Hat's offerings
  • Contribute to the development of repeatable methodologies and tools designed to scale Red Hat's services capabilities, promote repeatable customer engagements, and lower delivery risk
Required skills:
  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or a similar field
  • 5+ years of application development leveraging modern languages and frameworks like SpringBoot, Node.js, Vert.x, Python etc.; polyglot is a plus
  • Experience implementing microservices architectures using event-driven, reactive, and domain driven design approaches
  • Experience with the design, full-stack development, testing, and deployment of large, distributed applications
  • Solid understanding of database design using SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Experience with agile development environments practicing test-driven development (TDD), pair programming, and open source or code sharing models
  • Experience with developing applications for a orchestrated container framework like Kubernetes
  • Experience with design and implementation of comprehensive CI/CD pipelines
  • Demonstrated experience communicating value, progress, and metrics of key projects to required stakeholders and diverse audiences
  • Solid written and verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, influential, project management, and planning skills
  • Willingness to travel in the future will be required to work alongside leading financial services, retail, telecommunication, and institutional customers, in line with Red Hat COVID guidelines
  • Experience with front-end development using modern frameworks like React.js, Vue.js, or Angular is a big plus
  • Experience in a consulting or a similar customer-facing role is a plus

#LI-REMOTE


About Red Hat:
Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.


Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

job.title: Backend Software Engineer
job.body:
About Qualytics

Qualytics is building a data quality surveillance platform to help our customers monitor and actively defend against data pipeline corruption. Our innovative technology includes a Data Firewall that monitors and learns from the flow of data, allowing us to detect and respond to anomalies in real time with active measures such as a message-level quarantining. As a company, our goals are to:

  • Build the next generation of data quality and surveillance tools for the enterprise
  • Help our users (Data Engineers, Scientists, Analysts and the C-suite that serve them) validate, affirm, and instill trust in their data management systems
  • Maintain a company culture that is as fun as it is stimulating

We bootstrapped our way to a demoable MVP and have since raised a seed round of funding from Venture Capital firms and top tier angel investors.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented Backend Engineer to round out our early team. You understand the difference between solving hard computer science problems and writing highly maintainable code in a team setting, and are able to balance both of those with the trade-offs that come with the ability to move quickly and make a significant impact in an early stage startup.

You’ll get to work directly with our experienced entrepreneurial team, which includes four multi-time founders with prior successful exits. In this role you will wear multiple hats, reporting directly to the CTO, and will have an opportunity to take on a leadership position (if desired) as we scale.

What You'll Do:

  • Design and architect new systems, focusing on performance and scalability
  • Work at all levels of the stack from K8S/Terraform to Spark/Scala/Kafka to Python/FastAPI/React with plenty of influence over how we evolve it.
  • Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining core features, end to end.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company in a cross-functional setting, including the CEO and our CTO as we get ready to grow and scale.

Who You Are:

  • A software engineering generalist with data engineering experience who cares deeply about user-centric product development.
  • Have a deep knowledge of cloud technologies generally and hands-on experience with at least some portions of our stack.
  • Take a thoughtful approach to decision making; knowing when to move fast and when to do things right.
  • Have strong product sensibilities, and enjoy perfecting the details that matter.
  • You don't stop writing code when it works, but instead ask yourself what you can do to make it better and more readable.

Requirements:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience with backend web development
  • 2+ years of experience with Scala and Spark applications
  • Demonstrated ability to break down large projects into smaller pieces that add value incrementally, and make tradeoff decisions about effort vs scope.
  • Mastery of Python/FastAPI, Java/Spring Boot or similar API-development framework
  • Fluency in SQL and familiarity with multiple datastores (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, RedShift, etc)
  • Comfortable designing, developing and consuming RESTful APIs
  • Familiarity with best of breed tooling (git, circleci, k8s, docker, )
  • Desire to push oneself to learn and grow on a daily basis
  • Desire and ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment
  • Desire and ability to give & receive rigorously candid feedback

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with terraformed k8s clusters on major IaaS (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • HTML5, JavaScript (React.js, Vue.js or AngularJS), CSS3, ES6
  • 2+ years React.js or Vue.js experience
  • Operational experience with Kafka and/or Spark Streaming
  • Experience working in a startup.
  • Experience working in a big company (our customers tend to be larger).

Why Work Here?

We founded Qualytics based on our collective experiences working at a number of early-stage technology companies grappling with challenges related to data quality. We realized how few products are available to help organizations maintain quality & trust in their data pipelines. We're here to change that with a platform capable of detecting and proactively responding to data anomalies before they result in ML model drift, corruption of your aggregated calculations, or other pollution of your downstream systems.

Qualytics is a values-driven organization, and we are excited about what we do. We're flexible, honest, hardworking, and collaborative. As a team, we bring our diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences together to create better individual work experiences. We support and challenge one another to bring out the best in each of us, and it seems like we have a little fun along the way. We are lifelong learners, and support ongoing training and professional development on a wide variety of topics.

Qualytics is a remote-first company with a small team spread across 3 different time zones and 2 countries!

Perks

  • Competitive salary and equity: we pay up for great talent
  • Unlimited vacation: we trust you
  • All the benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance, the works
  • Work with a passionate and dedicated team

This is a Remote (work from home) position.

  • Demonstrate broad solutions technical leadership, impacting significant technical direction, exerting influence outside of the immediate team and driving change.

PREREQUISTIES:
  • Minimum of 10 years of professional experience developing applications using the latest Java, React, Node technologies.
  • 3+ years of solid, hands on experience with ReactJS/Redux, Electron, JavaScript, REST API, SASS, Webpack, Node, Express, Docker, Docker-Compose, RabbitMQ, MongoDB, SOA, Jenkins, ECR.
