job.title: Sr. Digital Product Manager
job.body:
Invesco is one of the world’s leading global investment managers, entrusted with managing $1.2 trillion* in assets on behalf of clients worldwide. We are the 6th largest US retail asset manager and the 13th largest investment manager globally, and our more than 8,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. We are purely focused on managing a comprehensive range of active, passive and alternative investment capabilities, which we draw on to provide customized solutions aligned to client needs, our most important benchmark. (*As of May 31,2019)


Job Purpose:
We are seeking a seasoned Product Manager to join our award-winning Digital Experience and Customer Journeys Team which consists of Product Managers, UX/UI Designers, and Creative Developers/ Web Producers. As a member of a growing team, you will have direct influence on our entire digital ecosystem, and the outcomes that we deliver for our clients and the business. The ideal candidate will strategize and execute plans to build products and features that focus on fostering client awareness, engagement and acquisition. S/he will leverage customer insights to deliver a useful and personalized client experience resulting in increased consideration, engagement, usage, loyalty and advocacy of our brands across all client segments. We are looking for a hands-on, highly engaged, self-motivated individual to work across departments and the capability to deliver cutting edge digital products that have a direct positive impact on the bottom line. Why come to Invesco? Our team is undergoing an enormous digital transformation through building and commercializing innovative experiences for our clients and investors. We’re focused on becoming the most customer-centric firm in our industry and want people who are excited to be a part of the journey. If you think you have the profile to help us. We’d love to hear from you. About the Team We balance work & fun - the product team works hard all day to make the best possible products we can, but we celebrate our success and failures We also bring together the whole remote team several times a year, to build team relationships, and talk about all the work we’re doing. We’re open & honest with each other - we have a culture of trust, continual improvement, and mutual support We’re always learning, always teaching and we know how to apologize for and learn from our mistakes


Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead agile software product development (full SDLC), and serve as the key liaison between the business, user experience design, and technology
  • Distill the long-term vision and strategy for the digital tools & servicing experiences, and build the roadmap to get us there
  • You will oversee product and feature discovery in order to find new ways to lift KPI's related to reducing friction, customer satisfaction, and nurturing clients
  • You will create and define the features and customer experience through high quality business requirements, and user stories while managing the scope of each release
  • Qualitative and quantitative data analysis is in your DNA, and you will use it to balance constraints and customer needs to ensure execution of the full product lifecycle process from concept to launch
  • Help your product team move forward swiftly through rigor, discipline, and transparency in decision making and removing roadblocks

Work Experience:

  • 4+ years of experience working in a digital or related role with at least 3 years of hands-on product management or product design experience
  • Stellar design instincts, knowledgeable of new digital product trends.
  • Proven experience working in an Agile/Scrum and Lean environment in a Product Owner role.
  • Excellent competency in product/project management tools
  • Experience with using research techniques to advocate for our users & synthesizing feedback into priorities
  • Experience and familiarity with Financial Services, Fin-Tech, B2B industries, SaaS
  • Experience and familiarity working with React.js, AWS, Java, Google Analytics, Mulesoft/API, Adobe enterprise suites
  • Experience and familiarity with investment concepts, statistics and portfolio construction

FLSA (US Only): Exempt

job.title: Full Stack Engineer
job.body:
Qualytics is building a data quality surveillance platform to help our customers monitor and actively defend against data pipeline corruption. Our innovative technology includes a Data Firewall that monitors and learns from the flow of data, allowing us to detect and respond to anomalies in real time with active measures such as a message-level quarantining. As a company, our goals are to:

  • Build the next generation of data quality and surveillance tools for the enterprise
  • Help our users (Data Engineers, Scientists, Analysts and the C-suite that serve them) validate, affirm, and instill trust in their data management systems
  • Maintain a company culture that is as fun as it is stimulating

We bootstrapped our way to a demoable MVP and have since raised a seed round of funding from Venture Capital firms and top tier angel investors.

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented Full-Stack Engineer to round out our early team. You understand the difference between solving hard computer science problems and writing highly maintainable code in a team setting, and are able to balance both of those with the trade-offs that come with the ability to move quickly and make a significant impact in an early stage startup.

You’ll get to work directly with our experienced entrepreneurial team, which includes four multi-time founders with prior successful exits. In this role you will wear multiple hats, reporting directly to the CTO, and will have an opportunity to take on a leadership position (if desired) as we scale.

What You'll Do:

  • Design and architect new systems, focusing on performance and scalability, while crafting a great UX.
  • Work at all levels of the stack from K8S/Terraform to Spark/Scala/Kafka to Python/FastAPI/React with plenty of influence over how we evolve it.
  • Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining core features, end to end.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company in a cross-functional setting, including the CEO and our CTO as we get ready to grow and scale.

Who You Are:

  • A software engineering generalist with data engineering experience who cares deeply about user-centric product development.
  • Have a deep knowledge of cloud technologies generally and hands-on experience with at least some portions of our stack.
  • Take a thoughtful approach to decision making; knowing when to move fast and when to do things right.
  • Have strong product and design sensibilities, and enjoy perfecting the details that matter.
  • You don't stop writing code when it works, but instead ask yourself what you can do to make it better and more readable.

Requirements:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience with full stack web development
  • 2+ years of experience with Scala and Spark applications
  • Demonstrated ability to break down large projects into smaller pieces that add value incrementally, and make tradeoff decisions about effort vs scope.
  • Mastery of Python/FastAPI, Java/Spring Boot or similar API-development framework
  • Fluency in SQL and familiarity with multiple datastores (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, RedShift, etc)
  • HTML5, JavaScript (React.js, Vue.js or AngularJS), CSS3, ES6
  • Comfortable designing, developing and consuming RESTful APIs
  • Familiarity with best of breed tooling (git, circleci, k8s, docker, )
  • Desire to push oneself to learn and grow on a daily basis
  • Desire and ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment
  • Desire and ability to give & receive rigorously candid feedback

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with terraformed k8s clusters on major IaaS (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • An eye for design + strong product sense.
  • 2+ years React.js or Vue.js experience
  • Operational experience with Kafka and/or Spark Streaming
  • Experience working in a startup.
  • Experience working in a big company (our customers tend to be larger).

Why Work Here?

We founded Qualytics based on our collective experiences working at a number of early-stage technology companies grappling with challenges related to data quality. We realized how few products are available to help organizations maintain quality & trust in their data pipelines. We're here to change that with a platform capable of detecting and proactively responding to data anomalies before they result in ML model drift, corruption of your aggregated calculations, or other pollution of your downstream systems.

Qualytics is a values-driven organization, and we are excited about what we do. We're flexible, honest, hardworking, and collaborative. As a team, we bring our diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences together to create better individual work experiences. We support and challenge one another to bring out the best in each of us, and it seems like we have a little fun along the way. We are lifelong learners, and support ongoing training and professional development on a wide variety of topics.

Qualytics is a remote-first company with a small team spread across 3 different time zones and 2 countries!

Perks

  • Competitive salary and equity: we pay up for great talent
  • Unlimited vacation: we trust you
  • All the benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance, the works
  • Work with a passionate and dedicated team

This is a Remote (work from home) position.

job.body:
(

Work Locations

:
Hilton - Systems Solutions - McLean
7930 Jones Branch Drive
McLean 22102

***This position will be Remote based***

From smartphone capabilities like Digital Key to connected rooms that allow for integrated entertainment, temperature and lighting controls, Hilton’s Global Technology team is responsible for creating the hospitality experience of the future – for our guests, owners and Team Members. Through innovative technology development and deployment, this team ensures Hilton has the technology needed to support our continued global growth while remaining at the forefront of hospitality technology innovation.

What will I be doing?

This Lead Software Engineer role, is an outstanding opportunity to use programming talents to validate cyber security task automation, fast response, control measurement/reporting, and improve investments in existing technology solutions through API integration. You will play a meaningful role in developing and maintaining custom programs, tool integrations, improving methods for carrying out measuring controls, and finding new ways to improve Hilton’s security incident response capability. Bring your software engineering skills to the Hilton team!

  • Develop software which permits measurement of configurations, performance, anomaly detection, and standards conformance.
  • Improve development of tool integrations through product APIs.
  • Collaborate with Hilton Cloud architecture groups, and DevOps teams, to further develop information security automation systems.
  • Work to integrate, and further develop, Agile software development practices and adoption of CI/CD DevOps tools/processes (e.g., Bamboo, GitLab).
  • Build, manage, and maintain documentation in the form of architectural diagrams including system level services and network flow documentation.
  • Establish, improve, and apply secure coding practices including ongoing maintenance of secure code repositories, code error checking, and processes including static and dynamic code analysis.
  • Partner with other Global Information Security Team Members to review and ensure development and automation systems are secure.
  • Build and check resilient tasks that involve multiple moving parts.

What are we looking for?

We are seeking problem solvers who are passionate about growing market share in a dynamic industry and who love to combine their analytical skills with business intuition.

  • Solid grasp of Systems development lifecycle (SDLC)
  • Knowledge of application development scripting and automation techniques
  • Familiar with researching and using external tool/vendor API libraries
  • Experience with development of cloud native serverless architecture
  • Demonstrable understanding of two or more following technologies: Gitlab, Atlassian Stack, GraphQL, Docker, Splunk SPL, XML, SQL
  • Knowledge of data quality, data operations, BI/Data WH/Data Lake, data architecture, and general data management concepts
  • Collaborative and interpersonal teammates, who build positive relationships, exhibit tact, and earn trust

To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:

  • Seven (7+) years of work experience in Technology or related field
  • Six (6) years of software development experience in a medium to large corporate environment
  • Three (3) years developing backend applications with languages such as node.js or Python
  • Two (2) years spent developing frontend applications with frameworks such as Angular or React
  • Two (2) years of experience developing APIs using REST, XML, or GraphQL
  • One (1) year using DevOps tools and CI/CD toolchains such as Atlassian, GitLab, Docker, or Splunk

It would be useful in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or Associate’s Degree with six (6) years of related IT experience or a High School Diploma/GED with twelve (12) years of related IT experience
  • Three (3) years of experience with database management and technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, and SQLite RDBMS as well as NoSQL environments
  • Two (2) years of experience with network security or system security development
  • One (1) year spent developing applications for a cloud native serverless architecture
  • CISSP, CSSLP, OSCP, or other relevant security or software engineering technical certification
  • Familiarity with Ansible, Confluence, Jira, NAT, Git, Terraform, and network orchestration

What is it like working for Hilton?

Hilton is the world’s leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For over a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities, and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

job.title: Senior Backend Engineer, Audio
job.body:
This is a pivotal moment in the life of The New York Times. We have declared ourselves a subscription-first company, staking our future on producing journalism that is worth paying for and is unparalleled in its quality, depth and breadth of coverage. Connecting our expanding readership to our quality journalism is one of our most vital and exciting challenges as we move towards reaching our goal of 10 million subscriptions by 2025 .

Over the past few years we have been growing our Audio team to better support successful efforts like The Daily (1 billion downloads since 2017), Rabbit Hole , 1619 and Still Processing , and adding to those efforts through acquisitions like Audm and Serial Productions . While people increasingly find themselves with less and less time, the natural human need to be informed, enriched and entertained remains strong, and we believe there’s a great opportunity with audio to help build products that better meet people where they are.

We are looking for a Senior Backend Developer to join the Audio tech team to work on an NYT audio experience. The Senior Backend Developer will work closely with mobile developers, product and design team members, as well as the NYT Audio editorial team.

You demonstrate:

  • Belief in our mission: You have a passion for the news and for making the Times an indispensable daily destination for our readers.

  • Technical competency: You have deep knowledge of API design, content management and backend systems, and keep up to date on changes in backend frameworks, languages and overall developer community.

  • Code cleanliness: You have an understanding of what makes code well structured, maintainable and flexible and strive to create a culture where quality code is valued.

  • User focus: You care deeply about how design, engineering and product decisions contribute to creating a seamless, engaging and enjoyable user experience.

Your Responsibilities:

  • You will implement features and systems related to content management, mobile API, DevOps and other components to support a native mobile app.

  • You will contribute to backend architectural decisions, technical roadmap and timeline estimations related to all aspects of the backend system.

  • You may contribute to some front end development.

  • You will help promote standards in development and delivery, and engage with the community of developers at the Times.

  • Where applicable, you will integrate with broader New York Times platform code, which may be at least partially written or have dependencies written in Go, Javascript and Java.

Your Qualifications:

  • Experience working in Node.js, GraphQL and Go (a plus not required).

  • Some experience with front end development frameworks, such as React

  • Experience with content management systems, specifically related to audio or video.

  • Experience building APIs directed to support mobile apps, ideally with audio streaming/download support.

  • Experience building on public cloud platform services: Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Google Cloud Platform

  • Knowledge of software principles, application architecture, data structures, coding conventions, and security practices.

Benefits and Perks:

  • Make an impact by supporting our original, independent and deeply reported journalism.

  • We provide competitive health, dental, vision and life insurance for employees and their families

  • We support responsible retirement planning with a generous 401(k) company match.

  • We offer a competitive parental leave.

  • We are committed to career development and ongoing learning supported by a formal mentoring program as well as $8,000 annually for tuition reimbursement.

  • We have frequent panel discussions and talks by a wide variety of newsmakers and industry leaders.

  • Join a community committed to the richness of diversity, experiences and talents in the world we cover, supported by a variety of employee resource groups.

This position is based in New York, NY and we are open to remote candidates.

This role may require limited on - call hours. An on - call schedule will be determined when you join, taking into account team size and other variables. On - call hours are unpaid, unless informed otherwise by your manager.
LI-AM1

The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. job.title: Senior Security Developer - Java/JavaScript/Ruby - Remote
job.body:
Your Opportunity

Our new Senior Security Developer will continuously improve New Relic’s transparency into our current compliance status to near real-time monitoring, understanding the weight of repetitive, time-consuming tasks and minimizing their impact across New Relic through automation, streamlining, and integration with existing systems.

We seek an experienced Software Developer with a strong leaning towards information security and/or security compliance. With a passion for and proven experience in continuous improvement, can you envision a world where 3rd-party audits are substantially facilitated by automation that can be executed by anyone in the organization, with significant and impactful results? If, “Hell Yes,” is your answer, let's talk!

In addition to our Portland, San Francisco, or Atlanta offices, we are open to remote candidates who can work West Coast hours from a home office and have >1 year of success working remotely with a distributed team!

What You’ll Do

  • Build and maintain scripts and applications to automate audit management and minimize audit fatigue;
  • Develop scripts to extract data from different environments and repositories to support automation;
  • Develop custom tools using our stack (Ruby, Python, Javascript, Rails, Node.js, Docker, Google Scripts) to integrate well with our existing internal tools (i.e. Git, Jira, GRC solutions), supporting compliance tasks and security controls testing;
  • Automation and development of dashboards to provide relevant and measurable security information and a holistic view of our compliance posture.

Your Qualifications

Must-have:

  • 5-7 years software development experience using languages such as Java, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, and/or Golang;
  • Ability to lead requirements discussions - translating to use cases - leading to automation and efficiencies;
  • Curiosity, positivity, and a desire to work within a culture that values connection, authenticity, and empathy;
  • An appetite for solving problems through data gathering, systematic analysis, creative thinking and collaboration;
  • Experience working with JIRA, Git, Cloud APIs, AWS;
  • Demonstrable sound judgment in decision making-situations around risk assessments, recommendations, policies and controls;
  • Ability to provide Security Compliance transparency;
  • Dedicated to help our internal partners, empowering them with self-service methods, documentation, tools;
  • Cloud security best practices;
  • BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Information Technology or equivalent relevant experience.

Nice-to-have:

  • Demonstrable experience implementing bidirectional integration for disparate systems (e.g. Jira with a GRC Tool);
  • Direct experience managing audits (e.g. SOC2, FISMA/NIST 800-53, PCI-DSS) including coordinating with auditors and internal partners;
  • Working knowledge of NIST 800-53 controls;
  • Knowledge of GRC, as well as enterprise security monitoring and management tools;
  • Knowledge of GDPR.

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

About Us

New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.

Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.

Our Hiring Process

New Relic takes seriously our stewardship of the data of our thousands of customers worldwide. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification.

We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/Document/FCO%20Poster%20Set%20All%20Languages%2010%2001%2018.pdf

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek a diverse applicant pool and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here: https://newrelic.com/termsandconditions/applicant-privacy-policy

job.title: Principal Engineering Manager
job.body:
Do you see yourself as a coach, a collaborator, and a customer-focused engineer? Would you be excited working on a service that intelligently supervise and auto-heal hundreds of thousands of servers in Microsoft 365 Cloud? Do you care deeply about fostering a great team? We are looking for an Engineering Manager for the Substrate Monitoring team who embraces these roles and is excited by this technology.

Our team is building the next iteration of Monitoring platform that is responsible for detecting customer impact across all of Microsoft 365 services and communicating it to millions of customers. Our goal is to build a scalable infrastructure that seamlessly integrates with Microsoft suite of products to efficiently understand impact and accurately notify our customers while keeping in mind the overall end to end experience.

We are looking for an Engineering Manager who embraces the cultural values of inclusion and belonging and feels empowered to be the following:

Coach - Work with each person on your team to help them to do their best work and grow. You define and foster an identity for the team that includes a reputation for high quality, reliability, and inclusivity. Define the business goals for the team then create and execute on a plan to meet those goals.

Collaborator - Strive to understand the motivations and goals of the teams we’re working with and work towards a better-together collaborative solution. Influence partners to work on quality in a unified way across the organization.

Customer Focused Engineer - Care deeply about the end-user experiences we are building and the availability and reliability of the service that enables those experiences. Prioritize mitigation and restoring service for customers during outages over root cause understanding.

More About Microsoft 365 and Substrate
Microsoft 365 is the fastest growing cloud services business in Microsoft. M365 brings together cloud versions of our most trusted communications and collaboration products like Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive and Skype with the desktop suite of Office products in an always up-to-date integrated service offering. Since its launch, the service has made it easier for millions of information workers across the world in small, medium, and large enterprises to use the best of Microsoft’s business productivity solutions via the cloud. The service now extends the same capability to consumer communication and collaboration products. You can read more in the Substrate Dev Center located here: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/substrate

Responsibilities

  • Lead, support and grow a team of engineers and data scientists and deliver high quality business objectives.
  • Provide leadership to an integrated remote team in Chine and Latin American regions: work with a peer EM’s to define joint goals execution plan.
  • Visit the remote team locations at least once a year.
  • Provide hands-on technical leadership: architecture, design, code reviews, development, quality assurance and live site.
  • Partner with Program Management team to meet immediate and longer-term business objectives.
  • Hire and retain top talent.
  • Foster a healthy and inclusive team environment.
  • Be a mentor for the people on your team and help them grow.

Qualifications

  • BS/BA in computer science, or equivalent in related technical experience. Individuals with a degree in a non-STEM field (or without a degree at all) who have retrained as a software engineer and demonstrated a commitment to lifelong learning are strongly encouraged to apply.
  • Experience as an engineering manager, or a technical lead with a passion for coaching and mentoring others.
  • Hands-on experience coding in any object-oriented programming language. Expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript/NodeJS and web development frameworks/tools like ReactJS/AngularJS/Webpack is a plus.
  • 10+ years of experience building commercial grade software, with much of that experience in a large scale, high availability service.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job.title: UX/UI Developer
job.body:
At Greenlight Guru, we help companies build medical devices that improve and extend the lives of millions of people. Quality managers and engineers use our Software as a Service platform to build quality into their device development process.


Greenlight Guru is looking for an experienced UX/UI Developer to join our UX team. We’re experiencing rapid customer growth and need your help to design key product features for our core SaaS platform to better enable and empower our customers. In this role you will be working closely with our Data Scientists to create visualizations and AI backed application functionality. Your goal is to make designs that take complex machine learning algorithms and make them easily digestible and understandable for our users. Your creativity will help strengthen our relationship with customers through the creation of a unique journey in our SaaS platform. Your analytical mindset will serve you well as you collaborate with our Data Scientist teams to construct a state of the art user experience.


On a given workday with the Greenlight team, you will:


  • Collaborate with the product & cross-functional teams to ideate and design new feature sets, as well as iterate and evolve our existing product
  • Lead UX development of innovative product features including complex data visualization
  • Develop and communicate complex ideas with simple visual designs, employing whiteboards, Balsamiq, and Adobe XD
  • Translate design concepts into interactive prototypes with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Support multiple projects simultaneously, working collaboratively with the development team to support new features, ongoing development, and product enhancements
  • Work with our UX team to use and evolve our design system, ensuring consistency across our application suite
  • Keeping up to date with industry advancements, new regulations, and medical device innovations to influence product design

Great-fit candidates will have:

  • Experience designing for AI/machine learning/data visualization.
  • Portfolio demonstrating visual design skills, information hierarchy, interaction design, user research, and strong design process ideology
  • 3+ years of experience
  • Experience with UI prototyping and development
  • Strong understanding of design thinking and human-centered design philosophy
  • Keep up with the latest trends and techniques in design, UI, and UX

We’ll be extra excited to talk to you if you have:


  • Background in cognitive psychology and behavioral science
  • Experience in the medical device industry or similarly regulated industries

Benefits:


  • Co-workers who care deeply about our mission to spur medical device innovation and helping each other grow professionally
  • Flexible hours
  • PTO
  • Health insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • 401k

This is a full-time, permanent position available fully remote, or based out of our downtown Indianapolis HQ. We do not offer Visa sponsorship or relocation assistance at this time. No recruiters, please.

job.title: Senior Director, Account Management
job.body:
EPAM is committed to providing our global team of 36,700+ EPAMers with inspiring careers from day one. EPAMers lead with passion and honesty and think creatively. Our people are the source of our success and we value collaboration, try to always understand our customers’ business, and strive for the highest standards of excellence. In today’s new market conditions, we continue to support operations for hundreds of clients around the world remotely, with the vast majority of our teams working from home. No matter where you are located, you’ll join a dedicated, diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.


Description


You are strategic, resilient, engaging with people and a natural self-starter. You have a passion for solving complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join EPAM as a Senior Director of Account Management to work with enterprise clients across North America selling EPAM integrated product engineering, design and consulting services. Scroll down to learn more about the position’s responsibilities and requirements.
#LI-DNI
#LI-DNP

What You’ll Do

  • Create business strategies to successfully achieve client business goals:
    • Act as the Regional Client Partner with clients, internal teams and BU Heads / Sales Leads owning a portfolio of $30MM USD +
    • Align with EPAM Account Managers and Account Management Senior Leadership to co-develop / support Account plans and strategies for delivery, growth, and client satisfaction
    • Serve as the engagement architect, responsible for regional account plans and strategies, and work directly with client product, platform, and/or technology teams to position the engagement and EPAM for success
    • Be a highly motivated self-starter with a proven track record of sales performance with large corporate accounts
    • Understand the intersection between technology, customers, and business
    • Be comfortable presenting to senior audiences
    • Serve as a “Trusted Advisor” to the client, engaging in strategies and roadmap discussions
    • Stay abreast of current and emerging trends, unique opportunities and challenges of the space/markets and geographies in which the clients operate, and how it affects clients’ business and initiatives
  • Develop and oversee delivery approaches:
    • Work closely with project/program management to ensure successful delivery through an integrated delivery model
    • Responsible for shaping solutions and properly scoping / pricing engagements, establishing optimal operating models and project team organization, and leading the transition from the sales process to the delivery phase
    • Create and maintain monthly pipeline, track its progress and report to management at any given point
    • Post COVID, may need to travel as much as 20% to visit clients, home office, and attend conferences, etc. While Chicago is preferred as a base location, another location within the Mid West region is also acceptable
    • Serve as the product owner; partner with clients to help craft the product vision and roadmaps and create compelling customer value propositions and strategies
  • Build successful relationships:
    • Establish and cultivate strong relationships with clients at senior levels as well as external and internal partners to maximize growth within an account/client portfolio
    • Develop effective relationships with key internal executives, BU heads, Solution SME’s, and Sales and Delivery Leaders
    • Deliver on EPAM’s growth and performance objectives
    • Drive account revenue within the client / account portfolio as well as accelerate opportunities to influence and sell-in end-to-end EPAM services
    • Align with EPAM BU’s goals and objectives, support company financial goals by achieving revenue and profit targets
    • Support sales / pre-sales activities by acting as the lead to assess opportunities, respond to RFP’s, create proposals and presentations, establish relationships with clients and prospective clients, and help to close / sign new deals

What You Have

  • 10+ years of demonstrated track record of developing and growing client relationships and leading teams delivering end-to-end solutions
  • Experience managing a regional group of accounts and internal and external partners
  • Knowledge of technical platforms, business models, subject matter, and trends – with a focus on CPG, Travel, Hospitality, Manufacturing, and Retail industries
  • Minimum 7 years of successful sales experience in Engineering Driven Technology industries
  • Minimum of 10 Years of B2B software services sales
  • Good understanding and exposure to skills particularly around Java, JavaScript, Data (Big Data, AI, ML), DevOps, Embedded, Cloud, etc
  • Strong problem solving and creative thinking abilities
  • Ability to operate at the strategic level, yet being close enough to the details to add value to clients and be a real support to the team
  • Experience in managing and monitoring performance metrics across large scale accounts and account portfolios
  • Exceptional leadership/management skills and superb oral and written communication skills, with seasoned presentation skills
  • Strong industry knowledge or experience with particular emphasis on strategy, consulting, team management and product development
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Track record of leading teams
  • Proven ability to manage client engagements under high stress to successful completion
  • Sound business acumen; strategic skills; common sense
  • Effectively manages up and down
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher

What We Offer

  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (Subsidized)
  • Health Savings Account
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care, Commuter)
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability (Company Provided)
  • Life and AD&D Insurance (Company Provided)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
  • Matched 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
  • Paid Time Off
  • Legal Plan and Identity Theft Protection
  • Accident Insurance
  • Employee Discounts
  • Pet Insurance

job.title: Frontend JavaScript Developer -- REMOTE
job.body:
Frontend JavaScript Developer

REMOTE POSITION IN TEXAS


Our headquarters are located in Westlake Village, CA. We are an internet company that has specialized in the live video chat market since 1996. Our product reaches a global audience and the growth of our business constantly presents new and interesting opportunities. Team members constantly face unique challenges that make it fun to come to work every day!


About the Job

We are currently seeking mid-senior-level and experienced candidates for an open Frontend JavaScript Developer position on our team. The ideal candidate must be able to work remotely with very little supervision as well as would be well-rounded and able to work well with designers and PHP programmers. This is a full-time position in our Westlake Village office, looking to hire soon.


Responsibilities

  • Able to confidently articulate how the JavaScript solutions answer user needs, business goals, technical constraints and other projects facets, and translate that into a working bridge between PHP developers and designers/frontend developers.
  • Able to work WITHOUT frontend JavaScript frameworks.
  • Responsible for implementing vanilla JavaScript code across multiple sites and applications.
  • Responsible for building reusable code and libraries for future use.
  • Responsible for optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability.

Qualification Requirements

  • Must know ES5 and ES6 JavaScript
  • Must have a portfolio of code or a webpage
  • 2+ years of professional experience with JavaScript.
  • Great understanding of modern browser differences and what approach needs to be taken to create similar results.
  • Abreast of JavaScript design best practices, trends and techniques.
  • Must be able to program with vanilla JavaScript, other JS frameworks are a plus but not necessary.
  • Experience working with live video (hls, rtmp, webrtc, html5 media elements) a huge plus.
  • Good understanding of markup and style sheets: HTML5, CSS.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.

job.title: Web Developer (Remote)
job.body:
Love music? Come sit with us. At our core, we help creative people make better music with cutting edge technology.

Output is seeking a Web Developer to join the Web Development Team to play an active role in the creation, execution, management and maintenance of Output's various web properties and services. The Web Developer will work closely with nearly every department including marketing, product, operations, and design, ensuring each department's needs are met on Output.com. A successful candidate must be self-motivated, detail-orientated, technically savvy, and energized to research and learn new technologies that may benefit Output's web practices.

Responsibilities

  • Build web pages in WordPress and other platforms.

  • Take ownership of projects/features as they arise.

  • Work alongside the design team to build and edit web pages.

  • Work alongside the marketing team to edit and consult on web-related work.

  • Work with web development to plan and execute revisions to the company's sites.

  • Ensure company site is fully functional at all times and quickly fix issues.

  • Follow the instructions of senior web development staff.


Requirements

  • Fluency in PHP, JS, Sass/CSS, RESTful API integration.

  • Professional experience with WordPress themes & plugins, WooCommerce, Gutenberg blocks.

  • Experience in building functional front-facing webpages, with a keen eye for design/details and SEO best practices.

  • Experience reading design documents (PSD, Zeplin, Sketch, etc.) and extracting assets.

  • Proficiency with front-end coding and debugging. Understands and applies principles of page optimization, such as media queries, asynchronous loading, and caching.

  • Strong understanding of ES6, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, CSS frameworks (eg Bootstrap), version control (Git/Github).

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Output has made a name for itself as one of the fastest growing, creative, and influential music-making software companies in the world. The likes of Kendrick Lamar, Bjork, Rihanna, James Blake, Imagine Dragons, Justin Timberlake, Nine Inch Nails and many more use our software to write music as well as hit shows and films like Stranger Things, Game of Thrones, and Black Panther.

We are a strong group of like-minded music makers and music lovers sharing the common goal of helping music makers around the world be creative. We're bonded by music. We're motivated by challenging and fulfilling work. And we always do it while having fun.

We are currently working remotely and will continue to do so until it is safe to return to our office in Los Angeles. Once we are able to return it will be on a voluntary basis. We have successfully launched new products, achieved record sales, and continue to thrive as a team working from home. This has opened us up to hiring permanent remote positions around the country. Our culture has always valued our employee's work-life balance and we offer 5 weeks of PTO, excellent health care, and a community of music enthusiasts- with access to our music studios (once it is safe to return).

job.title: Front End Engineer
job.body:
This is a remote position.

This position will be open and accepting applications until 5 PM EST on January 26, 2021.

Most of our Federal contracts require U.S. Citizenship to be eligible for employment.


Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Our work enables agencies to meet the needs of their users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government.

We're looking for a front end designer to help us better share our story with a larger audience of like-minded designers, engineers and product folks interested in making a difference. You'll contribute beautiful, functional front-end code that brings our designs to life, while serving as a valuable bridge between our design and engineering teams.


Requirements

  • All work must be conducted within the U.S.
  • As a contractor to the federal government, all hires may be required to complete additional background screenings at the time of hire or any time thereafter as requested.
  • Our technical screening involves completing our homework assignments exclusively - we do not do any form of whiteboarding in our process. You can read more about our homework here.

What You'll Do

  • Leverage modern front-end frameworks like React to deliver performant and maintainable front-end applications
  • Translate mockups and comps into working client-side single-page responsive web applications in HTML, CSS/SASS, and JavaScript.
  • Integrate with various back-end APIs, and collaborate with team members to ensure back-end services meet the needs of our front-end systems
  • Ship software that impacts the lives of millions of Americans

What You'll Bring

  • 2 + years of experience developing consumer-facing web applications
  • Building applications using a client-side framework such as AngularJS, Ember.js, or React.
  • Optimizing client-side web applications for speed and performance.
  • Understanding of the fundamental technologies of the web: HTTP, SSL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JSON
  • Proficient spelling, grammar, and communication skills.
  • Must pass background check and provide references.
  • As a contractor to the federal government, all hires may be required to complete additional background screenings at the time of hire or any time thereafter as requested.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S now and in the future without sponsorship
  • Experience with Node JS and React
  • Experience with React
  • Experience with Typescript
  • Experience and understanding of one or more different agile methodologies, including Scrum, XP, or SAFe.

Benefits

  • Company-subsidized Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Use What You Need Vacation Policy
  • 401K with employer match
  • Paid parental leave after one year of service
  • Continuing education/annual conference attendance stipend

Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, pregnancy, disability, work-related injury, covered veteran status, political ideology, marital status, or any other factor that the law protects from employment discrimination.

job.title: React/Javascript Software Engineer- Marketing Technology
job.body:
Housecall Pro is headquartered in beautiful San Diego, CA and has recently announced plans for a Denver, CO hub. We are currently fully remote although excited to introduce a hybrid work model in the future that will allow for a combination of both remote and in-office work. We are currently open to candidates in San Diego or Denver, or those planning to move there.

At Housecall Pro, we're committed to making the everyday lives of home services professionals better by providing an end-to-end SaaS platform that runs all aspects of a home services business, including scheduling, dispatching, CRM, invoicing, payment processing, and marketing.

Our vision is to revolutionize the home services experience.

Our mission is to unlock the potential of every Pro.

The home services industry remains vast ($700b+) but relatively untouched by technology and unencumbered by a primary competitor. The 3M+ mobile businesses in home services are facing dramatic change as the world shifts from offline to online. Housecall Pro will be there to help these businesses that keep America's homes working navigate their transition to technology adoption.

The role: React/Javascript Software Engineer

We're looking for a React/Javascript Software Engineer to join the marketing technology team. You will primarily be responsible for the development and maintenance of frontend features that support our main marketing website and related initiatives. This includes integrating your frontend features with our content management system to support the needs of content creators across the company. You will ensure that these features are robust and easy to maintain. You will work in a fast-paced, iterative environment, with other developers working on different layers of our system, developing use cases that benefit our customers. A strong commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential. Your customer-centric focus is critical for our and our customers' success.

Our Engineering team is extraordinary. We're a hardworking and focused team driven to deliver industry-leading apps to our service professional customers. Our success is their success. Our team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused team members are the "engine room" of Housecall Pro, helping our customers operate and grow their businesses.

What you'll be doing:

  • Design, develop and deploy reusable features for Housecall Pro's core marketing site
  • Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code
  • Collaborate and work iteratively with designers and the leadership team to develop rapid prototypes and fully-realized web experiences serving millions of requests
  • Work on architecting our headless CMS system to create a performant integration
  • Develop and implement features that integrate with eventing software (i.e. experience in Segment, Google Analytics a plus)
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Identify and correct browser compatibility problems and ensure UX designs are properly translated to responsive solutions across a wide range of device resolutions
  • Develop and maintain code quality standards and enforce them across the team
  • Continually introduce architectural improvements and refactorings to the code baseline
  • Write automated tests at the appropriate architectural level
  • Conduct code reviews and architectural reviews for features developed by other members of the team
  • Maintain and improve our continuous integration and development environments
  • Learn, master, and stay abreast of the latest web technologies, including: Gatsby, Netlify, Contentful, Javascript, and React

Qualifications:

  • Ability to work at a fast pace with a drive to quickly deliver value to our customers
  • Self-directed, comfortable working with ambiguity, creative problem-solving, and ownership of big initiatives
  • BS, MS or Ph.D in a computer science / computer engineering program or demonstrable experience
  • 2-5 years industry experience developing commercial React
  • Advanced knowledge of Javascript, HTML, and CSS
  • Data Driven
  • Attention to detail and an eye for good design
  • Experience with Javascript development tools and libraries
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect React applications to back-end services
  • Proficient understanding of Git and Github
  • Experience with JAMstack technologies like Gatsby, Contentful, and Netlify a plus
  • Experience with Redux a plus
  • Experience with GraphQL a plus
  • Applied experience with Material Design or other frontend UI frameworks a plus
  • Experience with Segment a plus
  • Experience with A/B testing a plus

Why Housecall

  • Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company. Our co-founder/President envisioned a software company to help service professionals like his father (a house painter), get to a better life.
  • We save our service professionals time, and help them, in turn, to delight their homeowner customers.
  • We are tackling the last, large market ($700b+) untouched by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor.
  • Our goal is to build a $10 billion+ company that is a powerful brand to home service providers and consumers
  • We have fun at work. Really.
  • We have a N.A.P. (No Acronym Policy) so we all speak the same language.
  • Competitive compensation and benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employee assistance program, 401K)
  • Our passionate employees bring their authentic selves to work. Housecall Pro employees are encouraged to create employee resource groups to make the world better.
  • Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs
  • Paid holidays and self-managed (unlimited) paid time off

Housecall Pro celebrates belonging and diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees to include equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Housecall Pro is an equal opportunity employer; committed to an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Austin, Remote)
job.body:
Craft's technology helps enterprises be smarter, and our vision is to build the digital intelligence layer of the enterprise technology stack. Our approach to delivering this vision starts and ends with the team we can attract, and how well we can empower the most creative and effective team of people in the technology sector.

Craft is an enterprise intelligence company helping organizations accelerate data-informed business decisions. Our unique, proprietary data platform tracks thousands of real-time signals across millions of companies globally, delivering best in class monitoring and insight into global supply chains, among other company cohorts. Our clients, including Fortune 100 companies, government agencies, asset management groups, and others, use our technology for supply chain intelligence, market intelligence and related use cases. Through our modular, secure, customizable portal, our clients can monitor any company they are working with and collaboratively drive critical actions in real-time.

We are a well-funded technology company with leading investors from Silicon Valley and elsewhere.

We're not your typical SaaS startup. Our CEO is a seasoned entrepreneur and Juilliard-trained cellist. Our team is equally composed of musicians/artists/teachers and people into sports and the outdoors. The Craft team is globally distributed across the US, Canada, UK, and Belarus, with a physical HQ in San Francisco, and members in cities such as Seattle, LA, Salt Lake City, and Boston. We fully support and encourage remote workers!

We are an equal opportunity employer who values and encourages diversity and belonging at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Craft is seeking a motivated and skilled Full Stack Software Engineer, with experience building integrated, scalable, and robust SaaS applications and APIs.

In this role you will

  • Build beautiful, well-tested features and services using technologies like React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, GraphQL, and AWS. We value learning and growing together instead of knowledge of every specific technology
  • Work in small, empowered feature teams with teammates across Design, Product, and Data Science to drive complex features from start to finish, across the full stack, including but not limited to the Craft Enterprise Portal, Craft Company API (currently 300+ endpoints)
  • Have unlimited opportunity for taking ownership of features and areas with increasing scope, and for technical and leadership growth
  • Provide thoughtful, constructive code reviews in an environment of mentorship. We can all learn from each other regardless of title.
  • Advocate for modern engineering best practices, and use metrics to measure change
  • Be encouraged to learn more about how a SaaS company works beyond engineering, to form stronger connections across disciplines, which ultimately leads to designing and building best-in-class products and services

We'd love to hear from you if

  • Have a proven track record of successfully built products and services, typically 4+ years experience
  • Show curiosity through asking questions, digging into to new technologies, and always trying to grow
  • A "Builder" of new products, not an "Optimizer" of existing products
  • Have experience working with databases like Postgres or MongoDB, and knowledge of AWS/Cloud, Terraform
  • Good knowledge of multiple frameworks, and/or specialized systems
  • Experience implementing complex software systems and services
  • Strong team player, great listener, able to facilitate discussion and assimilate diverse opinions towards clear decisions
  • Self-starter, independent, likes to take initiative

A Note to Candidates

Studies have shown that women and people of color tend not to apply for jobs unless they feel they meet exactly all items in the job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidates and they may come from a nontraditional background. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't match everything listed in the job description.

Meet Your Manager

Alex D'Angelo has over 16 years of professional software development experience. In his words: "I build collaborative, effective engineering teams and help develop leaders, all in service of making great products people love. I foster a supportive environment, where being open and vulnerable leads to deeper connections, growth from taking risks, and a stronger team overall. I'm also a huge fan of the Muppets and experimenting with baking bread."

Interview Process

We want you to have a great interviewing experience and see this as a conversation. To help you prepare, the outline typically (but subject to change) looks like

  • Recruiter (20 min) - non-technical phone call to discuss Craft, your background and answer questions.
  • Hiring Manager (30 min) - non-technical video call to do a deeper dive into your background, the role and opportunity.
  • Home coding exercise (< 30 min) - a small problem in a language of your choice. We're interested in the discussion, not watching you type, and keep it short to respect that you have responsibilities outside of the job search.
  • Technical (60 min) - Video call reviewing the exercise, & deep dive on the design of a recent project of your choice.
  • Final Interview (90 min) - Video call covering culture & product.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary + equity at a well-funded VC-backed startup
  • Unlimited vacation time
  • Option to work remotely
  • Excellent covered health, dental, and vision insurance + 401K
  • Monthly allowance for gym/wellness, Audible/books, internet, cell phone, and snacks
  • High-end Apple laptop, and ergonomic workstation allowance
  • Fun coworkers
For this specific role, Craft can only accept applications from US citizens or permanent residents.

job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (SF Bay Area, Remote)
job.body:
Craft's technology helps enterprises be smarter, and our vision is to build the digital intelligence layer of the enterprise technology stack. Our approach to delivering this vision starts and ends with the team we can attract, and how well we can empower the most creative and effective team of people in the technology sector.

Craft is an enterprise intelligence company helping organizations accelerate data-informed business decisions. Our unique, proprietary data platform tracks thousands of real-time signals across millions of companies globally, delivering best in class monitoring and insight into global supply chains, among other company cohorts. Our clients, including Fortune 100 companies, government agencies, asset management groups, and others, use our technology for supply chain intelligence, market intelligence and related use cases. Through our modular, secure, customizable portal, our clients can monitor any company they are working with and collaboratively drive critical actions in real-time.

We are a well-funded technology company with leading investors from Silicon Valley and elsewhere.

We're not your typical SaaS startup. Our CEO is a seasoned entrepreneur and Juilliard-trained cellist. Our team is equally composed of musicians/artists/teachers and people into sports and the outdoors. The Craft team is globally distributed across the US, Canada, UK, and Belarus, with a physical HQ in San Francisco, and members in cities such as Seattle, LA, Salt Lake City, and Boston. We fully support and encourage remote workers!

We are an equal opportunity employer who values and encourages diversity and belonging at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Craft is seeking a motivated and skilled Full Stack Software Engineer, with experience building integrated, scalable, and robust SaaS applications and APIs.

In this role you will

  • Build beautiful, well-tested features and services using technologies like React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, GraphQL, and AWS. We value learning and growing together instead of knowledge of every specific technology
  • Work in small, empowered feature teams with teammates across Design, Product, and Data Science to drive complex features from start to finish, across the full stack, including but not limited to the Craft Enterprise Portal, Craft Company API (currently 300+ endpoints)
  • Have unlimited opportunity for taking ownership of features and areas with increasing scope, and for technical and leadership growth
  • Provide thoughtful, constructive code reviews in an environment of mentorship. We can all learn from each other regardless of title.
  • Advocate for modern engineering best practices, and use metrics to measure change
  • Be encouraged to learn more about how a SaaS company works beyond engineering, to form stronger connections across disciplines, which ultimately leads to designing and building best-in-class products and services

We'd love to hear from you if

  • Have a proven track record of successfully built products and services, typically 4+ years experience
  • Show curiosity through asking questions, digging into to new technologies, and always trying to grow
  • A "Builder" of new products, not an "Optimizer" of existing products
  • Have experience working with databases like Postgres or MongoDB, and knowledge of AWS/Cloud, Terraform
  • Good knowledge of multiple frameworks, and/or specialized systems
  • Experience implementing complex software systems and services
  • Strong team player, great listener, able to facilitate discussion and assimilate diverse opinions towards clear decisions
  • Self-starter, independent, likes to take initiative

A Note to Candidates

Studies have shown that women and people of color tend not to apply for jobs unless they feel they meet exactly all items in the job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidates and they may come from a nontraditional background. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't match everything listed in the job description.

Meet Your Manager

Alex D'Angelo has over 16 years of professional software development experience. In his words: "I build collaborative, effective engineering teams and help develop leaders, all in service of making great products people love. I foster a supportive environment, where being open and vulnerable leads to deeper connections, growth from taking risks, and a stronger team overall. I'm also a huge fan of the Muppets and experimenting with baking bread."

Interview Process

We want you to have a great interviewing experience and see this as a conversation. To help you prepare, the outline typically (but subject to change) looks like

  • Recruiter (20 min) - non-technical phone call to discuss Craft, your background and answer questions.
  • Hiring Manager (30 min) - non-technical video call to do a deeper dive into your background, the role and opportunity.
  • Home coding exercise (< 30 min) - a small problem in a language of your choice. We're interested in the discussion, not watching you type, and keep it short to respect that you have responsibilities outside of the job search.
  • Technical (60 min) - Video call reviewing the exercise, & deep dive on the design of a recent project of your choice.
  • Final Interview (90 min) - Video call covering culture & product.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary + equity at a well-funded VC-backed startup
  • Unlimited vacation time
  • Option to work remotely
  • Excellent covered health, dental, and vision insurance + 401K
  • Monthly allowance for gym/wellness, Audible/books, internet, cell phone, and snacks
  • High-end Apple laptop, and ergonomic workstation allowance
  • Fun coworkers
For this specific role, Craft can only accept applications from US citizens or permanent residents.

job.title: Director of Information & UX Design
job.body:
About the Role

New Classrooms is responsible for developing innovative offerings that promote personalized learning models and tailored pathways for students. Working cross-functionally and cross-organizationally with designers and developers, this role represents a unique opportunity to work in a collaborative environment designing experiences and presenting complex information and data to multiple users and stakeholders throughout our programmatic journey. This includes but is not limited to, program communications and introduction, platform experiences, and program performance & impact reporting.


This is an exciting time at New Classrooms as our mission of creating and inspiring better ways to give every student an educational foundation for lifelong success has never been more important. The offerings team is critical to experimentation and our ability to support schools and students in this tumultuous time.

Our team spans a range of backgrounds, skill sets, and experience levels, but are all high-performing, dedicated, and fantastic to collaborate with. We are looking for someone who seeks out challenges, thrives in complexity, and finds satisfaction in making complicated things simpler using your design and technical expertise.


What You Would Do

  • End to end experience and information design involving both digital and print resources
  • Visual design for online applications and reporting tools
  • Development of data reports and visualizations for large and complex data sets that drive performance internally and in our partner schools
  • Visual design for support and product communications, including email, presentations and print
  • Develop assets including flat screen design, design specifications, style guides and interactive prototypes
  • Work with multiple teams to establish technical feasibility, and support implementation of designs
  • Ensure content is communicated as clearly as possible to drive audience engagement and action
  • Develop and promote a consistent design framework consistent with branding and style guidelines
  • Employ best practices including research and customer insights, wireframe & prototype development, design pattern libraries and usability testing

What We Are Looking For

  • A strong portfolio of work - demonstrating all types of design across various products and reporting platforms including information and UX design
  • A strong ability to communicate complex ideas and information with clarity to a wide variety of audiences
  • 5+ years of experience in digital design from ideation to delivery
  • Passion for visual and information design towards social and educational impact
  • Experience in developing visualizations for large and complex content systems, data sets and technology concepts
  • Strong project and time management skills and ability to work independently in an agile environment
  • Expert in design tools such as Adobe CS, Sketch, Zeplin, Axure
  • Established design approach, including presentation of design ideas and concepts.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Preferred knowledge or hands on skills in html, css, javascript and related frameworks

Role Classification, Benefits & Location

This role is full-time and includes benefits such as rich medical, dental, and vision insurance, 36 paid days off per year (prorated for the period in which you work), paid parental leave, an annual professional development budget and a quarterly cell phone subsidy. Although there is a preference for this role to be based in NYC when our office reopens, we are open to the role being remote for the right candidate.


Commitment to Diversity

At New Classrooms we are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We strive to create and inspire better ways to give every student an educational foundation for lifelong success. In order to fully realize this mission we are dedicated to building a diverse pool of candidates including those from underrepresented backgrounds, and resolute in building an inclusive culture that supports and celebrates the diverse voices and perspectives of our employees.


Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

job.title: Full Stack Developer (Remote)
job.body:
About us:

BuySellAds helps connect great brands with hard-to-reach audiences. You’ve probably seen our ad solutions on a number of creative sites such as Dribbble, Bootstrap, CodePen, Coding Horror, and many more.

We also work on our own internal projects and that’s where you come in. We’re looking for someone to help manage and grow our suite of design and development web properties on our Owned & Operated team. Working together as a small, tactical unit, we’ll either be maintaining and improving existing sites, or transitioning recently acquired properties to fresh buildouts when it makes sense. This is a really exciting and dynamic role! Finally, based on our team’s current skill sets, we will need this role to lean much more heavily towards back-end development - in fact we’d love for you to be our expert there.

We are a fully distributed/remote team and stay connected through Slack. We largely work around an EST schedule but are flexible.

Ideally, we’re looking for someone who is:

  • A natural problem solver: integrations and migrations can be messy work, requiring equal measures creativity and patience.

  • A self-starter: remote teams carry lots of autonomy. There’s no micromanaging here. This article really resonates with us!

  • A great communicator: we’re big on teaching, learning, debating, and explaining, and these things require clear, deliberate communication.

  • Experienced working across the full tech-stack

Some hard skills that’d we love to see:

  • 3+ years experience working with node.js and/or comparable languages (Typescript, React, Ruby, PHP)

  • 3+ years experience leading database management (MySQL, Redis, GraphQL, Postgres)

  • 3+ years of experience developing thoroughly tested back-end code

  • Understanding of security best practices and server workflows (i.e AWS, DigitalOcean, Git)

  • Proven track record of learning new development languages, tools and technologies

  • Experience leading projects from implementation to completion


Interested?

Amazing. Send along your resume and cover letter telling us why you’d like to join our team!


We do our best to make the hiring process fair and straightforward: we do an initial meet-and-greet Zoom screen, and follow with a team pairing to make sure our culture makes sense. We move quickly on decisions, and we aim to respond to every applicant and provide feedback where appropriate: even if we aren’t the right fit for each other, we want you to know rather than have to second-guess.


This is a remote position.

job.title: Software Engineer (Can be Remote)
job.body:
Company Description

We're Element 84 and we're taking on some of the biggest challenges in software: petabyte search, consumer streaming, and Earth science repositories, just to name a few. We are a team of gamers, musicians, artists, pitmasters, pilots, and tinkerers and we think you might have fun helping us solve some big problems. Element 84 was founded by husband-and-wife engineers and has grown into a skilled group of developers, designers, project managers, and business team that build high performance systems for some of the biggest corporate and government clients in the world. Our main office is located in Alexandria, VA but we support a large remote workforce from Michigan to Texas and Pennsylvania to Colorado.

Paying attention to who we are - as a company, as people, as family members, friends, and colleagues, is probably the biggest part of who we are. There are lots of ways to run a company and you have probably experienced more than your share. For us, it's wanting to come to work, being around people we enjoy, taking on big things with people you trust, and sharing our achievements as a team.

  • You’ll get credit when things go right and we’ll have your back when things go wrong.
  • We only take on work that is challenging and right for us. There are projects we will turn down and the team has a say.
  • We may be a small company, but we have big company benefits meant to support the idea that we're here for the long term and that happiness comes from much more than just where you work, including 401k, health & dental insurance, life & disability insurance, paid parental leave, flexible schedule, cell phone stipend, flexible spending accounts for health, transportation and dependent care and a generous PTO policy.

We have an extraordinary retention rate because we only hire extraordinary people. We hope that’s you.

Element 84 is looking for an experienced Software Engineer. As a member of the team you will support the operation of the next generation cloud-based platform for a government transportation program.

Please submit your information, resume and cover letter if you are interested in this permanent position headquartered in the Washington, DC metro area. Remote candidates welcome.

Element 84 is an equal opportunity employer, with a company culture that values diversity. We embrace inclusivity and believe that diversity of thought, perspective, and experience helps us reach higher and think bigger. If you are interested in joining us, we want to hear from you!
