job.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web
job.body:
Location Details: Mozilla's US office locations include San Francisco, CA, and Portland, OR. We are also open to you working from your home office anywhere in the US for this position.

At Pocket, our mission is to enable people to consume stories worthy of their time and attention. Our apps and platform are essential ways that over 100M people discover and consume content on the web.

Are you excited about the role of content to enrich users' lives? Do you want to build software for a massive audience? We are looking for a passionate, driven, web-focused Senior Software Engineer to help make this happen. Our Frontend team builds the Pocket experience on the web, our extensions and our integrations with the Firefox browser. Pocket has become essential to how people discover and consume content worthy of their time and attention on any device and on their own time. If you are passionate about using technology to improve people's lives, we believe Pocket has challenges ahead that will excite you.

Pocket, a subsidiary of Mozilla, is committed to an internet that elevates critical thinking, reasoned argument, shared knowledge, and verifiable facts.

Come work with us and make a huge impact on advancing high-quality content on the web!

What you'll do:

  • Join a high-impact team re-imagining how users discover, save, and consume high-quality content on the web.

  • Build products that impact millions of users.

  • Collaborate with engineers, designers, product managers, data analysts and support teams to implement our product and user experience strategy.

  • Contribute daily to decisions affecting the future of Pocket and its platform.

What you already have:

  • You have 3+ years experience developing rich web-based end-user applications.

  • You possess a thorough understanding of web technologies including, JS, CSS, DOM and HTML.

  • You have deep experience in one or more relevant front-end frameworks (like ReactJS and AngularJS), UI Test Automation frameworks, MVC frameworks.

  • You have experience being responsible for the full trip from designer hand-off to live implementation.

  • You design, write, maintain, and debug software in a cross-browser environment.

  • You uphold standards for quality and performance by performing code reviews, fixing bugs, creating tests, and profiling code.

  • You have knowledge of engineering and operational excellence best practices.

  • You possess a natural eye and passion for using good design principles to deliver web experiences that delight and empower users; in addition, you employ attention to detail in your work and have experience collaborating with a high performing design team.

  • You possess strong communication skills and an ability to approach problems in a structured way and distill complex issues into actionable insights.

If you don't meet 100% of the above qualifications we still encourage you to apply!

What's the team like?

We're a remote-friendly team headquartered in San Francisco, with more than half of our colleagues working from home, co-working spaces, or Mozilla offices. Video conferencing, Slack chats, and shared documents keep everyone in the loop and make sure no one feels isolated. We value transparency and collaboration from the CEO on down.

At Pocket (a subsidiary of Mozilla), we are a small agile team, which means each teammate has the opportunity to make a big impact. But we also keep it real: our working hours are flexible—not just because we have team members in different time zones—but because we know you have a life outside the office, and we value that. You're human, we're human, and everyone at Pocket is treated with utmost respect.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race (including hairstyle and texture), religion (including religious grooming and dress practices), gender, gender identity, gender expression, color, national origin, pregnancy, ancestry, domestic partner status, disability, sexual orientation, age, genetic predisposition, medical condition, marital status, citizenship status, military or veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable laws. We will provide reasonable accommodation to an employee or job applicant with a disability.

Group: D

Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Our work enables agencies to meet the needs of their users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government.

We're looking for a driven and organized Senior Software Engineer to help our team in delivering the very best digital services for the American people.

job.title: Digital Learning and Onboarding Expert for AI Platform
job.body:
RapidMiner is reinventing enterprise AI (Artificial Intelligence) so that anyone has the power to positively shape the future. We’re doing this by enabling ‘data loving’ people of all skill levels, across the enterprise, to rapidly create and operate AI solutions to drive immediate business impact. We offer a single platform that unifies data prep, machine learning, and model operations. We also have been designated as leaders in our white-hot market by both Gartner and Forrester for over 7 years in a row.

More than 40,000 organizations in over 150 countries rely on RapidMiner to increase revenue, cut costs, and reduce risk. We are venture capital (VC) backed with a work from anywhere policy, though our headquarters is in Boston (MA, USA) and we have locations in Dortmund (Germany), Budapest (Hungary), and London (UK).

Position Summary

We are looking for a Digital Learning and Onboarding Expert to join our education team. Your primary goal will be the success and happiness of our users. You will be responsible for ensuring that users can easily access relevant learning content easily and precisely when and where they need it. You will be instrumental in mapping different target users having varied motives and objectives to the right features, learning content and content delivery methods.

You will create learning content that transfers potentially complex data science and machine learning knowledge as well as RapidMiner product skills to a broad range of users. Users will have access through our Learning Management System (LMS) or directly within the product, where you will monitor its efficacy.

This position requires an understanding and a passion for creating multi-media enablement materials as well as the desire to analyze the impact on our users’ success. Successful candidates will have a passion for data, take pride in developing high-quality content, and enjoy working in a small, remote, collaborative, and agile team.

Position Duties

Evaluate our onboarding strategy and collaborate with marketing to design, implement and optimize our user onboarding experience with a strong focus on continuous improvements driving product adoption

Design and develop technical learning content, training materials and media including layout, video editing and voice overs.

Work with the Director of Analytics to exploit data measuring user activation, retention, and conversion as well as customer product adoption. Identify, define, and track suitable KPIs and milestones.

Work cross-functionally with internal product managers and developers on current and upcoming product changes to ensure training materials are up-to-date and to provide feedback to improve the product adoption based on user insights.

Work effectively with data science experts, customer success representatives, account executives, and partners to create fun, interesting, and sound instructional solutions and ensure efficient and effective full adoption of our technology.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Instructional Design, Business Informatics, or related field along with a minimum of two (2) years of experience in user onboarding or training, digital marketing, or customer analytics. In lieu of a degree, additional relevant experience will be considered.

The successful candidate must also have:

  • Proven success as a self-sufficient self-starter who takes ownership of long-term projects.
  • Strong interpersonal (verbal and written) communication, analytical, and time management skills.
  • Experience with information systems, business intelligence and data analytics.
  • The ability to take complex information and communicate it clearly, concisely, and accurately.
  • Knowledge and experience developing, designing, and delivering customer enablement content on software applications.
  • Experience using web-based learning management systems (LMS), Camtasia, Articulate, Storyline 2, Articulate Studio, Adobe Captivate, or other development tools.
  • Ability to work from home and within US East Coast or Central European standard office hours

Preferred qualifications include:

  • Strong interest in analyzing user behavior data including web traffic, SEO, user interactions and A/B-testing. Experience with data science and machine learning is a big plus.
  • Experience applying the principles of visual design to learning content and user interfaces.
  • Ability to work with web technologies such as CSS, HTML5 and JavaScript including React.
  • Proven ability to quickly learn all aspects of a software product.
  • Experience using RapidMiner, R, Python, Jupyter notebooks, Grafana, Docker and relational databases.

Benefits

RapidMiner offers highly competitive salaries, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities - all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

RapidMiner is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any legally protected characteristics.

RapidMiner does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that does not have a signed agreement with RapidMiner.

We are Loyal

Loyal to the solution

job.title: Senior PHP Developer
job.body:
Code Koalas is a growing web and app development company located in the Crossroads of Kansas City. We are passionately curious people who love learning, enjoy finding better ways to solve our clients’ business problems, and find satisfaction in clean code and excellent builds. Our promise is, “Your Idea, Built Right”, because we believe in coming alongside our clients to take the technical burden off of their shoulders, and build out their vision on a solid technical foundation so that they can do what they do best: grow their business. Founded by a self-taught developer and IT professional, we’re not as concerned with your degrees as we are with what you’ve built and how quickly you learn. We work hard here, we play DND on our lunch breaks, we equip you to grow in your skills, we give back to the open source community, and at the end of the day we go home. Learning is mandatory every day. Fun is mandatory on Thursdays. Sound interesting? Then read on!


Code Koalas is now hiring an experienced Sr. PHP Developer to work with our team in our Kansas City, Missouri office. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with our development and project management teams to deliver innovative custom solutions to our clients.


Candidates must be local to the Kansas City metro or planning on relocation, as this is not a remote position.



Job Description:


We are looking for a Senior Web/PHP Developer who has had experience with CMS. Drupal experience is preferred, but Laravel, Wordpress or equivalent are welcome. Your responsibilities will include configuring the backend of sites in Drupal, debugging issues on existing client sites, and building out new features for websites built with Drupal. You will be using PHP to customize templates and build out custom modules and 3rd party integrations. You will work with front-end web developers to match build out to client requirements and designs. You will be working alongside experienced Drupal developers and will be expected to grow and help raise up other developers to senior Drupal Developers.


Responsibilities:


  • Utilize ticket management system to work on assigned tickets.

  • Communicate with dev and project management team on status of tickets

  • Help break out tickets to meet the requirements of clients

  • Setup new Drupal websites with appropriate modules, content types and views

  • Setup user roles and permissions

  • Research issues and patch modules as necessary

  • Debug issues on client sites using tools like xdebug

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Create custom modules

  • Customize twig template files

  • Setup Drupal rest endpoints

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders


Skills and Qualifications:


  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

  • Strong understanding of working with a CMS

  • Strong understanding of web markup, including HTML and CSS

  • Strong understanding of PHP and Object Oriented Programming


  • Familiarity with custom Drupal modules

  • Familiarity with terminal commands ie bash, zsh

  • Familiarity with front-end build tools, such as npm, Webpack, Gulp.js

  • Minimum of 3 year web development experience (professionally or open source / volunteer)

  • Growth mindset - able to learn quickly on the job and not afraid to try new things fast


Must embody Code Koalas’ core values:


  • Be Open: We are transparent. We don’t horde information for ourselves, we advocate for open source, teaching and sharing what we learn and create to help others grow.

  • Be Humble: We treat everyone as equals. We never use our expertise to diminish, only to serve.

  • Be Discoverers: We aren’t content with where we are or how things have always been done. We search out a better way for ourselves, our company, and our clients.

  • Daring Ownership: We take risks. We embrace our failures and wins. We look beyond ourselves to how our actions affect everyone around us.

  • Think Long Term: We challenge small minded thinking. We don’t take the easy way out or create throw-away work. Everything we do is with an eye to the future.


A love for coffee, board games, nerf darts, and fun is required. Tea is acceptable.


Does this sound like you? Apply today, we'd love to meet you!

job.title: Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist
job.body:
You’re an experienced, energetic, and data-driven CRO Specialist with a fascination for how people use products and technology. You are equal parts analytical and creative, with a passion for your craft and commitment to helping clients grow their businesses through conversion-centric digital strategies and experiences. You enjoy collaborating with your teammates and client-side counterparts but also thrive in autonomy. You have a strong understanding and hands-on experience with A/B testing, website analytics and the UX conversion strategies and tactics that help clients improve the metrics that matter most to them. And, above all else, you want to join a global team that creates smart, creative and impactful solutions to complex business challenges.

Modus is a digital agency headquartered in New York City with offices in Buenos Aires and Manila. We’re an interdisciplinary group of motivated, dedicated professionals who don’t take things at face value. We uncover insights, imagine new possibilities, and create digital experiences that transform businesses and delight customers.

Overview

Our next CRO Specialist will be an integral part of our growing team, working across a range of clients and projects, with a particular focus on the agency’s largest accounts. The CRO Specialist is responsible for guiding the strategic success of our clients' Conversion Optimization (CO) engagements. Success will depend on the ability to enthusiastically and competently:

  • Develop impactful conversion and UX strategies — from data-driven ideation, execution, reporting, and analysis
  • Exhibit exceptional project management — from planning to delivery and continued growth
  • Build strong relationships; establish clear lines of communication with clients, partners, and internal team members; and use problem-solving capabilities to assure flawless program execution to meet and exceed stated objectives
  • Demonstrate a passion for continuous learning, iterating, and improving; a sound understanding of the digital marketing landscape; a zest for UX design and research and an entrepreneurial spirit to improve processes — from planning to strategy to deliver.
  • Collaborate with internal resources (including content, design, engineering, analytics, media planning partners, and cross-channel teams) and external clients to deliver great work together — and have fun doing it

Responsibilities:

  • Provide ongoing recommendations to help clients deliver on key metrics and KPIs, through continuous website testing and user experience improvements, with a focus on B2B and/or SaaS companies
  • Prepare and present findings, reports, and recommendations to senior-level clients
  • Create and execute deliverables that help inform the ideal experiences for users; this could include items such as website audits, web analytics reviews, user journeys analysis, heuristic reviews, wireframes, information architecture reviews, task flows, user scenarios, and persona development
  • Help drive the success of client engagements, as the subject matter expert on a number of conversion optimization and UX engagements; understand the entire process: from KPI definition to execution to insight discovery
  • Conduct UX research through both qualitative and quantitative methods
  • Apply knowledge of web analytics, user segments, and audiences as they relate to the optimization process
  • Be able to translate and communicate testing results and data-driven recommendations into an effective message, continually creating insights and value for clients
  • Perform best practices for departmental procedures that facilitate workflow and effective communication; contribute to the development and improvement of processes
  • Review new technologies and keep the company at the forefront of developments in digital marketing; provide thought leadership and perspective for adoption where appropriate

Desired Skills & Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in a website testing and/or UX focused role
  • Proven success in Conversion Rate Optimization, including tactical and strategic achievement, with samples and results of past campaigns
  • A bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Digital Marketing, Human-Computer Interaction, Economics, Statistics, Information Science, etc.) is preferred
  • Highly proficient in web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
  • Strong knowledge of one or more testing platforms, Optimizely experience a plus
  • Experience reporting on success/failure of optimization efforts
  • Strong proficiency in digital marketing and effective website design
  • Experience creating wireframes and functional/interaction specifications
  • A sound understanding of the mathematics behind effective testing
  • Strong digital proficiency, knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a bonus
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate articulately both verbally and in writing; positive client service experience
  • Agency experience a plus

In addition to a competitive salary, Modus offers a great work environment, premium health care plan, training courses and certifications, the opportunity to work with the latest technologies, and other great benefits.

We are also open to remote work for fluent English speakers in the 4 primary time zones of the USA, PT, MT, CT, and ET.

If you are self-motivated and enjoy being part of a diverse team of talented people who are inventing the digital future, apply now!

job.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer (Node.js / TypeScript / PostgreSQL / AWS)
job.body:
Job details

Salary
$105,000 - $145,000 a year

Full Job Description

Charityvest is “your personal charitable giving fund”. It offers workplace giving solutions, and personal charity funds for individuals. With Charityvest you can donate stock, make grants to any charity in the United States, and participate in a company matching program.

We are looking for exceptional engineers to join our team to help us grow and modernize the charitable giving industry.

We believe that software production is a craft. We give you the time, space, agency, and creative freedom to hone your craft in building products that people love and rely on.

This position will report directly to our CTO, Jon Koon. Jon is a seasoned technology leader. He spent 7 years at Twitter where he led company-wide web and mobile product initiatives. He was on the ground floor building the new React-based twitter.com.

You'll be joining Jon alongside a talented engineering team of fullstack, frontend, and backend engineers who pride themselves in the quality of their code and their team orientation. In whole they represent over 30 years of experience building fintech and consumer facing software.

Charityvest, Inc. is a nonprofit organization whose purpose is to advance and improve how charitable resources are deployed. It was launched in conjunction with Vennfi, Inc., a for-profit corporation which develops and operates the Charityvest platform. This role joins the team at Vennfi, Inc. to support the growth, development, and operation of Charityvest.

Vennfi recently participated in the Y Combinator Summer 2020 batch and following the program successfully raised 2.3M to accelerate product development, and marketing.

We are based in Atlanta, GA and plan to hire locally, but are open to remote applicants that live within a 3 hour time zone difference.

What you’ll do

  • As one of our early senior engineers, you will play a critical role in establishing patterns and building the foundations for our engineering organization.
  • You’ll be expected to drive initiatives from concept to production ensuring high levels of reliability
  • You will have significant input into the processes, practices, and tools we use.
  • You’ll work directly with designers, product managers, customers, and fellow engineers to ensure your solutions are on target.

Day-to-day

  • Building apis and serverless applications with Node.js and AWS Lambda
  • Establishing new best practices for building and deploying backend and distributed systems
  • Writing fault tolerant integrations with 3rd party payment apis
  • Configuring alerting, logging, and other observability systems to monitor and troubleshoot production systems
  • Writing unit and integration tests to ensure sensitive financial operations are done correctly and securely
  • Automating build, test, and deployment pipelines with Github actions and AWS Codepipeline
  • Database modeling and migrations for PostgreSQL
  • Improving the developer experience to accelerate yourself and fellow engineers

Requirements

  • You consider yourself a "product-centric" engineer and take pride in building something people love.
  • You are self-sufficient in initiating and prioritizing your own work
  • You understand how to balance the needs of engineering, product, marketing, and sales.
  • 3+ years experience doing backend development with Node.js and PostgreSQL (or similar RDBMS).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiar with best practices in engineering, architecture, security, and design for both backend apis, web, and mobile apps.
  • Familiar with best practices around microservices and distributed systems
  • Nice to have: Advanced JavaScript experience: TypeScript, Monorepos, Webpack
  • Nice to have: Experience with AWS: Lambda, SQS, Cloudfront, S3, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch
  • Nice to have: Experience working in a financial technology company (accounting, investing, banking, etc)
  • Nice to have: Experience with React.js

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity
  • Flexible vacation
  • Flexible remote and work from home policies
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plans
  • 401k
  • Paid parental leave
  • Swanky office at Ponce City Market in Midtown Atlanta (when it's safe to return)

We believe generosity is good for the world, and would want any employee to align with the inherent value of generosity as a human virtue.

We are committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by law. Everyone is encouraged to apply.

job.title: Lead Front-end Developer
job.body:
Who We Are: Founded in 2015, Mursion is a technology-driven, multi-disciplinary startup creating cutting edge virtual reality simulations. Our simulations are used globally by professionals across multiple industries to practice and master the complex interpersonal skills necessary to be effective in high-stakes professions. Mursion promotes a unique culture where individuals are able to be adventurous in the pursuit of improving human interactions. Ideal candidates at Mursion are team-players, comfortable working across remote teams and distributed environments, and invested in the idea that high impact learning experiences can be both powerful and playful.


Who We Want: We seek talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission to leverage virtual reality technology to reinvent professional learning, and who are motivated to help Mursion become the premier global platform for virtual simulation training for behavioral skills. We value empathy, curiosity, and constant improvement both in our internal operations and when working with partners and clients. Our employees are most successful when they employ strong collaboration skills, skilled communications, a problem-solving orientation, and demonstrate comfort in an evolving and fast-paced startup environment.


Position Overview: This is a full-time, salaried position reporting to the CPO. This role is based out of our offices in San Francisco.


Responsibilities:

  • Architect, design, and implement efficient and reusable frontend systems for the web application
  • Evolve existing User Interfaces to increase interactivity, intuitiveness, performance and overall user delight.
  • Working closely with our Product Owners, Project Managers, UX/UI team and other engineers to analyze new feature requirements, complete research spikes, create and size stories for development
  • Lead the evolution of the UI platforms while adhering to Agile practices
  • Assist in defining user interfaces and software architectures, collaborate with backend leads to establish workflows and APIs
  • Have a commitment for quality and writing clean, solid, readable code that scales and performs well
  • Analyze, design and develop test cases and implement automated test suites
  • Provide technical leadership and contribute to determining technical direction.
  • Help the team follow best practices for software development and testing.
  • Implement and maintain code documentation and code standards utilizing all code-repository SDLC features.


Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of experience in Front End/Full Stack Software Engineering roles in product companies
  • Hands-on coding experience with JavaScript, HTML, Typescript or similar
  • Familiarity in building and delivering highly scalable, reliable, and complex software systems in a hosted cloud environment using Java, Spring Boot, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, ReactJS, NodeJS
  • A BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
  • Passion for crafting elegant code
  • Knowledge of (and a passion for) current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability


Compensation and perks: Salary commensurate with experience. For full-time employees, Mursion offers competitive benefits, which include full medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401k matching program, paid holidays, and unlimited PTO.

Collaborate with a unique blend of employees ranging from 3D artists, software developers, operations, sales, and finance teams to actors who deliver interactive, highly immersive simulations.

Be at the forefront of reinventing learning for the future workforce.


How to Apply: Qualified candidates should submit a resume. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so interested parties are encouraged to submit as soon as possible.


Mursion is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from people of color, womxn, persons with disabilities, and the LGBTQIA+ community.


Company Values:

We cultivate empathy

Empathy is at the core of all we do. We make time to communicate and listen before we take action. We make decisions based on reasoned analysis and authentic care for the aspirations of our partners and colleagues.


We lead with curiosity to create lightbulb moments

Our team is strengthened by having the courage to thoughtfully ask difficult questions. We are results-oriented innovators who create dynamic solutions to complex problems by encouraging transparency, creativity, and iteration. We are energized by thought-provoking conversations and the diverse perspectives of our partners and peers.


We strive to raise the bar

We see ourselves as trailblazers in simulation. Our learning theory is grounded in research and we demand empirical evidence before concluding our efforts have been successful. We always look for ways to improve. We recognize we live in an imperfect world and we embrace our responsibility to promote shared understanding and elevate humankind.


We have the courage to be human

We are a fun-loving, driven team of developers, artists, entrepreneurs, operational masterminds, and technologists dedicated to the proposition that learning experiences can be powerful and playful. We recognize that we are more than a business; we are a community of unique individuals with a collective focus to improve human interactions through practice. It is through our humanity that we create better products and learning experiences for our partners.

job.title: Senior Ruby On Rails Developer | Full Stack | Remote
job.body:
Senior Software Engineer | Full Stack

THE ROLE

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll act as a leader on the engineering team and will use your expertise to support and guide others. You will be influential in the technical direction of the Dispatch platform as we continue to grow and will be a source of ideas on how to improve the platform overall.

We believe that product development is more fun when deploying early and often, splitting up work into bite-sized chunks and getting feedback from real users as quickly as possible. We also believe that a single engineer should be empowered to develop a feature from start to finish and that the technology stack should be simple enough to make that realistic. To that end, new team members ship code all the way to production within their first week on the job.

This is a full-time exempt role (computer employee exemption) that reports to the Director of Engineering.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Executes all job duties in alignment with Dispatch’s core values, mission, and purpose
  • Acts ethically, with integrity, and complies legal standards to deliver an environment that promotes respect, innovation, and creativity
  • Encourages and fosters an inclusive environment. An environment where the strengths and expertise of our workforce are welcomed, amplified, and exhibited in the work at Dispatch
  • Design and build high-quality features that meet business objectives with a focus on usability.
  • Provide mentorship to other members on the team to help them improve develop their skills.
  • Lead code reviews to keep the team aligned around the features being developed and to encourage best practices.
  • Deploy your projects to production frequently and monitor the results to ensure quality and positive outcomes.
  • Actively solicit feedback from teammates and customers to improve the usability of the features being built.
  • Work with the rest of the product team to come up with ways to make the product better overall.
  • Perform other duties as assigned (to be less than 10% of your responsibilities)

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

  • Strong interpersonal skills that will position you as a leader and as a mentor for others on the team
  • A track record of learning new technologies on the fly and finding the right tool for the job
  • Must be a positive, self-driven team-member with a desire to learn

WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
  • 5+ years experience building and supporting web applications in a full-stack capacity
  • Expertise with Ruby on Rails or Javascript/React, and an interest in getting your hands dirty on both backend and frontend
  • Bonus: React Native, iOS, Android, ElasticSearch, Google Maps APIs

ABOUT US

Dispatch is a technology-based company that redefines the way same-day deliveries are made in the B2B space. With our network of drivers, Dispatch puts suppliers, businesses, and technicians in control of local deliveries with real-time tracking and transparency. We strive to deliver the best value and service to our customers every day.

Dispatch started in the Twin Cities but is now in dozens of markets across the country. With all of this growth, we maintain a strong focus on our company culture. Dispatch operates on five core values: People First, Belief, Speed to Value, Driven to Deliver, and Transparency. If you connect with these values, we’d love to learn more about you!

Full Job Description

Summary

An integration analyst is tasked with planning, coordinating, and managing the assimilation of new software applications and programs into an existing computer network. The analyst typically supports each department by determining its systemic needs, recommending changes, implementing new software solutions, and instructing users about the interface. As computer technology continues to play a greater role in the effective operation of businesses and other institutions, the need for qualified integration analysts will continue to increase.

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Research new software packages and make system upgrade recommendations based on the organization's strategic goals.

2. The primary objective is to ensure all systems are generating the greatest productivity at the lowest cost.

3. Required to supervise the implementation process for outside software while also designing, coding and maintaining applications developed in house.

4. Collaborating with other tech-savvy team members in testing new applications to ensure functional requirements are met.

5. Install and migrate customers in the development, test, user acceptance and production environments. This may involve connections to value added networks or directly to customer systems.

6. Work closely with project managers and account managers on customer-specific projects

7. Write transition plans to handoff client implementations to support area.

8. Perform UI designs and coding, creating reusable objects and templates, wireframes for web pages and email templates; manage maintenance, updates, expansions, and scaling of each design

9. Involve production support or customer support when issues occur to have them notify customers of any status or data that may have to be resent or delayed.

10. Maintain development and user test environments.

11. Perform regular file backups to local directories for recovery

12. Mentor others in data communications setup and troubleshooting techniques.

13. Research new and more efficient ways of performing data communications.

Competencies

1. Technical Capacity.

2. Communication Proficiency.

3. Collaboration Skills.

4. Customer/Client Focus.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Travel

This position requires no travel.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

Position Type

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Some night and weekend work may be required.

Education and Experience

  • One to two years of experience in web development.
  • Experience using position-relevant software.
  • Experience with data encryption and security.
  • Experience sending data to networks.
  • Working knowledge of web applications, programming languages, and web services, such as APIs, CSS, CSS3, cross-browser compatibility, HTML, HTML5, JavaScript, JQuery, PHP, security principles, REST, SOAP, and web user interface design (UI)
  • Experience developing customized code for multiple projects simultaneously

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

job.title: Growth Marketing Manager
job.body:
Nearmap is unique. A global technology company with incredible people; a market-leader with energy and spirit. Nearmap was named as one of the world’s 10 Most Innovative Companies of 2020 by Fast Company magazine – and we’re growing.

We are looking for an amazing Growth Marketing Manager to join our team.


As part of the growth team, you will take our demand generation engine and scale it into our key vertical segments. You will champion business growth with a test and learn mindset and data-driven approach. If you wake up in the middle of the night thinking you’ve got an idea and want to test it, this is the perfect role for you.


If you join us on this exciting journey, you’ll love our inclusive values and share our ambition to become the source of truth that helps shape decisions for the liveable world.

What we do

We provide easy, instant access to high-resolution aerial imagery, city-scale 3D content, AI datasets and integrated geospatial tools, with wide-scale coverage across the USA, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. At the core of it, we’re a location content company, a visual analytics company, and a software as a service company. Innovation is weaved into our DNA.


What we are looking for

A typical day for you may look like this...

  • Leading the end-to-end strategy and execution of Nearmap's paid media campaigns including campaign execution, optimisation, creative testing, reporting, and landing page optimisation.
  • Managing campaign budgets efficiently whilst tracking and reviewing all digital and direct marketing campaigns to ensure delivery of ROI against business targets.
  • Partnering with external agencies and internal stakeholders to drive growth through data-backed testing and strategy.
  • Optimising campaigns by developing a roadmap through A/B experimentation framework to test new hypotheses, reduce CPA and increase LTV of customers.
  • Building exciting product-led growth tools that help scale the business and embed the product into our customer’s workflow.
  • Analysing and building weekly, monthly, and quarterly KPI reports to identify trends, efficiencies, threats and opportunities that can help scale the regional markets.
  • Working on growth targets such as new customer acquisition and upsell/cross-sell opportunity creation, whilst retaining the customer base using digital platforms such as Google Ads, Bing Ads, LinkedIn, and website.
  • Collaborating with the broader organisation on sales strategy, attribution, data analysis, new channel testing and other cross-functional initiatives.

For this particular role we are seeking someone with the following experience:


  • 3-5 years of experience in digital/growth marketing with a strong B2B growth mindset (with a Bachelor’s degree: preferably Marketing)
  • Experience in conducting A/B tests on digital advertising platforms and tracking using BI/CRM platforms (Google Ads, LinkedIn, SFDC, and Looker)
  • Basic knowledge in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Passionate about data, analysis and reporting and finding efficiencies at a granular level, with a keen eye for trends and insights (bonus points for experience with tools such as Looker!)
  • Proven track record of delivering successful online marketing campaigns across SEO, SEM, social media marketing that have resulted in tangible business results
  • Strong team player, excellent organization skills, and ability to set priorities. Able to work fluidly and at pace in a global, ever-changing dynamic environment.
  • Experience working with multiple stakeholders, including agencies, developers and writers.

Some of our benefits

Nearmap takes a holistic approach to our employees’ emotional, physical and financial wellness. Our current benefits include access to the Nearmap employee share scheme, short and long-term financial incentives, flexible working options, paid volunteer days, gym and phone rebates, and lots of development opportunities including hack-a-thons and pitch-fests.


Working at Nearmap

We move fast and work smart; often wearing multiple hats. We adapted to remote working with ease and are continually looking at ways to improve. We’re proud of our inclusive, supportive culture, and maintain a safe environment where everyone feels a sense of belonging and can be themselves.


If you can see yourself working at Nearmap and feel you have the right level of experience, we invite you to get in touch.


Watch our culture video and find out more about what a day in the life at Nearmap looks like: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7rikZqa8n8


Nearmap does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and search firms. Please do not email or send unsolicited resumes to any Nearmap employee, location or address. Nearmap is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Umbra Lab, Inc. (“Umbra”) is a technology company which builds next-generation space systems. Umbra is launching an unrivaled constellation of space-based radar satellites with synthetic aperture radar (SAR) capabilities, to produce all weather day-night imagery with sub-meter resolution for low cost distribution via an integrated web platform. We are a bold, experienced team of developers, engineers, product specialists, and other professionals working to aggressively expand the state-of-the-art for commercial remote sensing.

Umbra is looking for a talented, mission-driven professional to join our team as a Software Developer - Front End. The person in this role will collaborate with the software engineering team to develop and maintain web client applications that control next-generation satellite systems and deliver rich user experiences to our customers. As an early contributor, they will play a key role in Umbra’s efforts toward redefining how space radar data is consumed.

job.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
job.body:
WHO WE ARE:

The current web3 lending stack gives users the ability to utilize the time-value of their assets through lending protocols like Compound and Aave. DefiHedge builds upon this infrastructure to provide access to previously unfacilitated financial tooling, decentralized interest-rate derivatives.

Interest-rate swaps represent an overwhelming majority of the world's trading volume and with their introduction DefiHedge provides users the ability to take fixed-rate and leveraged lending positions.

Started at EthDenver 2020 and incubated through Gitcoin Kernel, DefiHedge is a community project at its core. With the backing of world-class investors and angels, DefiHedge is looking to fill out its team of forward and independent thinking developers to push towards our initial release.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Web3 connection & smart contract endpoint integration (Web3.js or Ethers.js)
  • REST API and database maintenance
  • Front-end <> Backend endpoint integration (React-Redux)
  • Cloud server deployment and instance management
  • Work across the entire stack (NodeJS, PostgreSQL, React-Redux) to build, test and ship high-throughput products on top of the DefiHedge Protocol

Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:

  • At least 5+ years experience working as a full-time developer
  • At least 3+ years experience with NodeJS
  • At least 1+ years experience with web3.js / ethers.js
  • You have a depth of technical experience and have demonstrated excellence through previous work
  • You have a high degree of autonomy and communicative ability, ensuring efficient collaboration with other team members

NICE TO HAVES:

  • 2+ years experience working with database architecture and deployment (PostgreSQL/MongoDB)
  • 1+ years experience with React frameworks
  • Familiarity with libp2p and DHT core concepts
  • You have worked on successful high throughput applications products in the finance or web3 space

Benefits

Fully-Remote

Healthcare

Equity

job.title: Director of Data & Business Intelligence
job.body:
Sunroom is reinventing leasing to empower renters.


We're a venture-backed tech startup, headquartered in Austin, that's dramatically improving the home and apartment search process. We believe that the existing tools renters use, like Zillow, are just scratching the surface. We've created a platform that enables renters to self-tour properties apply & lease inside our app. Sunroom was started by the Favor founders Ben & Zac.

What you'll be doing:

  • Lead business intelligence projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will inform strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.
  • Making technical architecture aand framework decisions to optimize our infrastructure and easily pull the data we need.
  • Monthly updating our financial model/forecast to ensure we're growing to plan.
  • Setting up a company and individual OKR reporting charts. Pulling data for board meetings and other company initiatives.
  • Ad-hoc analysis projects to assist with product & marketing measurements.
  • In the future, manage and develop a team responsible for maintaining reporting systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support key business decisions.

We're sitting on all sorts of interesting data, from the 100k renters using our site, thousands of property listings on our platform, and funnel data on what's driving conversions.


Team: You'll be joining a company that's small today (15 people). In this position, you'll work closely with the co-founders and the engineering team.

  • Today our engineering team consists of 3 talented engineers: David, Darius & Antonio.
  • As you can see the team is small so you'll start working independently, but in the future, you'll have a data team reporting to you.


Codebase: This is our stack. Our product was built mostly with Node.js & React. We've set up some systems for data/BI already, but you'll be able to play a major role in shaping our systems.


Our ideal candidate:

  • Intellectually curious: You'll full of questions that can create value for our customers and team members.
  • Self-directed and organized: You can size and prioritize data projects and determine what's most important.
  • Thrives in an iterative environment: You can adapt to changes in products, projects, and direction won't throw you for a loop. You know how to work quickly and balance quality with speed.
  • Technical: You are fine to roll up your sleeves and get the job done. You are excited about changing the future through amazing products.



  • 5+ years of experience working in data science or analytics.
  • Exceptional academic record with BA/Master’s degree from a top-tier college or university.
    • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent preferred, but not required.
  • Previous experience at a fast-growing startup.
  • Experience with the following tools, languages, and platforms:
    • Data visualization tools (i.e. Chartio)
    • Application programming languages (i.e. Python, SQL)
    • Reporting APIs + big data platforms (i.e.Redshift, Amazon Web Services)
    • Customer segmentation platforms (i.e. Segment)

Note: Our team is currently remote due to Covid-19, but we're excited to get back to the office when it's safe. Our ideal candidate will be willing to return to the office when the time is right.

job.title: Senior Engineering Manager: Frontend
job.body:
Have you ever wondered what happens inside the cloud?

Based in New York, DigitalOcean is a dynamic, high-growth technology company that serves a robust and passionate community of developers, teams, and businesses around the world. We believe that today's entrepreneurs are changing the world through software. Our mission is to empower these entrepreneurs by bringing modern app development within reach for any developer, anywhere in the world.

We want people who are passionate about helping developers build and deploy real world applications.

We are looking for a senior manager to lead our front end development team focused on building incredibly intuitive user interfaces. Reporting to the Director of Engineering, this person will lead a team that works across engineering and other functions to create a frictionless user experience for all of DigitalOcean's offerings.

DigitalOcean is loved by developers for its simplicity. This is an opportunity to lead a team focused on the DigitalOcean cloud UI experience. Consistency, simplicity and speed are all important components of this experience. With a strong brand and experienced engineers partnered with a great design team, you'll have what you need to run high-volume real world experiments that drive business results.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Leading a team composed of individual contributors and a manager to deliver an amazing user experience for DigitalOcean products
  • Own the management of front end infrastructure work across UI Engineering
  • Develop a vision and roadmap to continue to provide a wonderful UI experience as DigitalOcean and it's product offering grows
  • Driving a high-performance culture within your team that iterates frequently and learns continuously without sacrificing product quality.
  • Setting performance goals for team members; evaluating performance; providing coaching and facilitating professional development.
  • Providing technical leadership - best practices, testing, performance, reliability.
  • Recruiting and hiring world-class engineers.
  • Measuring the software development process to help the team increase deliverability and improve forecasting

What We'll Expect From You:

  • Passion for customers and the products we build for them.
  • Experience managing a high-performing cloud product development team of front end engineers or a mix of front end and back end.
  • Experience managing managers
  • Experience working closely with Product Managers and UX designers.
  • Experience with CI/CD and a 24x7 production environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead positive change; empower people; cultivate product technology visions and innovative solutions.
  • The ability to adapt and handle multiple competing priorities.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills with the ability to work closely across teams and manage dependencies.
  • Development experience with CSS, HTML, Javascript, and modern frameworks (React, Ember, etc.).
  • Experience with responsive and accessible app development a plus.

Why You'll Like Working for DigitalOcean:

  • We value development. You will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development through formalized mentorship, LinkedIn Learning tracks, and other internal programs. We also provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
  • We care about your physical, financial and mental well-being. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to support your physical health, and a commute or internet allowance to make your trips to your office or your desk easier. We offer generous parental leave with transition time built-in upon return to work. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match.
  • We support our remote employee experience. While we have great office spaces in NYC, Cambridge and Palo Alto, we're very distributed—we use a number of communication tools to connect across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices and meet their teams face-to-face at team offsites. We also have an annual company offsite, Shark Week, to get quality in-person time with the entire company at least once a year. We also allow employees to outfit their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in office.
  • We value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer, API Integrations
job.body:
WELL is a patient communication infrastructure for healthcare. We enable enterprise health systems, private practices, and vendors to conduct seamless conversations with patients across multiple channels — including texting, email, telephone, and live chat.

With WELL, patients receive all of their healthcare communication from one trusted source — their provider. The platform empowers service representatives to converse with patients in real time, ensuring patients feel heard while driving staff efficiency and increased revenue.

Founded in 2015, WELL is based in Santa Barbara, California and is the highest rated patient engagement software on G2. WELL serves many of the country's leading health systems and more than 20 million patients.

WELL is proud to have been named one of the 2020 Central Coast Best Places to Work by the Pacific Coast Business Times and one of the 2020 Best Places to Work in Healthcare by Modern Healthcare. To learn more about WELL, please visit our LinkedIn.

SUMMARY

WELL is looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-paced, growing engineering department. You will primarily be working on API Integrations. You will work with other bright and motivated software engineers under the guidance of our Director of Software Architecture.

You will be responsible for developing new and improving existing internal product APIs used by the Integration team to ultimately provide data to and from our clients. You will work closely with stakeholders from the Product and Integration teams to gather requirements for client use cases, and you will be responsible for designing and implementing elegant APIs and data models that will best fulfill those requirements.

In addition to being a strong developer, you will need strong communication skills to work with a distributed team and be motivated to build quality software. You will also be flexible and adaptable enough to thrive in a fluid startup environment. This is an exciting role with room for growth.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designing, developing, and maintaining products, services, APIs and integrations for the WELL platform
  • Collaborate with the Product and Integration teams in an Agile environment to break down requirements, plan, design, and estimate tasks
  • Drive quality by writing effective unit, Integration, and functional tests for high availability and high throughput systems and libraries in an AWS ecosystem
  • Architecting solutions using the latest security and compliance standards for healthcare
  • Building tools to monitor system performance and reliability at scale

REQUIRED

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
  • 3+ years of experience in a software engineer, software architect, or other software development role
  • Experience with Java, Node.js or other Object-Oriented programming language
  • Hands-on experience with SQL, entity modeling, and relational databases
  • Experience in designing RESTful APIs, event-driven workflows, and microservices
  • Test automation experience – Jest/Mocha/Junit/Spock/Groovy unit testing, TDD, testing pyramid
  • Experience with AWS or other Cloud technology
  • Strong communication skills and an ability to interact with all levels of technical and non-technical audiences
  • Strong commitment to producing quality products
  • Extremely detail-oriented
  • Teamplayer that is a positive attitude, and a passion for WELL's mission

BONUS

  • Healthcare experience with Electronic Medical Records Systems, Practice Management Systems, Interface Engines, or other healthcare standards
  • Experience building modular microservice applications in Node.js, Spring Boot, or other microservice frameworks
  • Knowledge of software development best practices and familiarity with common design patterns
  • Experience with Jenkins or other continuous integration and continuous delivery tools
  • Experience with GIT, SVN, or other version control system
  • Experience working in an Agile environment (Scrum or Lean)
  • Experience using Jira or other issue trackers
  • Familiarity with Terraform or other Infrastructure as Code tools

LOCATION

WELL is headquartered in Santa Barbara, CA and has a satellite office in Orange County, CA. Today, all WELL positions are remote, and we are looking forward to when our company returns to in-office work. We are open to candidates that are looking for a permanently remote role depending on their level of experience. Historically, remote team members visit the Santa Barbara office regularly, and we've found that works best when they are on the West Coast, specifically in Southern California.

PERKS AND BENEFITS

Fantastic company culture – frequent Zoom company events (Lunch & Learns, trivia, yoga, etc.) and daily fun brought to you by many creative Slack channels.

Workplace groups – company committees available for all to join (Diversity & Inclusion and Workplace Engagement).

Learning and development – frequent events and tools available to help our employees #PursueGrowth.

Career mobility – we promote from within and have opportunities for employees to transfer between teams.

MacBook Pro provided

Unlimited vacation/PTO and a flexible work schedule

Generous equity package

Full health benefits – medical/dental/vision


WELL Health Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to fair and equitable hiring practices. All hiring decisions at WELL are based on strategic business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. All candidates are considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other protected status.

We're dedicated to creating an inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplace, where everyone feels safe to be themselves and diversity is a strength. WELL is committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment; WELL will not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind.

Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Superfeed Technologies, Inc. is seeking a Senior Mobile Engineer to play an integral role in a company that is shaping the way people consume content online.

We've developed a product that is revolutionizing the way we consume news and information. Superfeed® is an information superhighway app that gives users control of the news, information, and social media content they see. It brings all their desired content from websites, social feeds and channels into a unique user experience that is engaging and interactive. In the Superfeed® platform, users create their own algorithm by fine-tuning their settings for each source of content, giving them their perfect feed.

The core functions of this role are to use your experience in Mobile App Engineering, to guide the development of the Superfeed App in both the Apple and Google Play Store. Help to ensure the App is optimized for all devices and that the App's designs are functioning at a high level.

If you'd like to join a high-energy start-up that's backed by the support and resources of a well-established company in a great work environment located in beautiful Anthem, Arizona, check out what we're looking for and join us at Superfeed.

Superfeed is currently not sponsoring H1B visa. All applicants must be authorized to work in the United States and must be available to work in person in Anthem, Arizona.

job.title: Cloud Database Engineer
job.body:
Cloud Database Engineer for RDS Database Automation (PostgreSQL)

ActBlue builds and maintains a powerful online fundraising platform for Democratic campaigns, progressive organizations, and nonprofits working to create a better future. We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors by making it easier for grassroots supporters to make their voices heard and by helping thousands of groups — from presidential candidates to environmental organizations — build people-powered movements.

We're a nonprofit organization, and our team has a big impact on the future of our country. Each and every one of us, from the political activists to the tech innovators to the customer service pros, is fully committed to our mission.

We are seeking a Cloud Database Engineer who is passionate about automation and building great tools in a security conscious environment. We offer autonomy, responsibility, and amazing colleagues geeking out about politics and tech all day, plus generous benefits.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

  • Automating database systems processes including backups, transformations, clones, and creation across RDS and Containers
  • Maintaining and improving database scrubbing transformations for dev/test environment with automated refresh procedures
  • Making sure metrics, monitoring (DataDog), and alerting are optimized and constantly improved upon for our database solutions
  • Maintaining backup and recovery tools and processes are in place and monitored
  • Disaster recovery documentation, planning, and testing
  • Troubleshooting performance issues
  • Security and access control based on job role with associated monitoring and logging
  • Learning from alerts. After an event, we learn from it, continuously improving our infrastructure, monitoring, or applications to keep the same issue from ringing alarms again.
  • Building visualizations of our data to understand the performance of our systems and recommend improvements to remove bottlenecks and points of failure.
  • Anticipating and proactively addressing security concerns from both process and technology standpoints.

WHAT YOU'LL BE WORKING WITH:

  • Stack: Kubernetes, Docker, Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Node.js, Redis
  • Tooling: Terraform, Jenkins, Rundeck
  • Hosting: AWS
  • Monitoring: DataDog
  • Databases: RDS and containerized (mostly PostgreSQL)

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • Experience managing databases in a high volume mission critical environment
  • Experience with database replication, monitoring, and troubleshooting
  • Knowledge of and a passion for repeatable configuration management
  • Knowledge of AWS and big data solutions (Redshift, EMR, etc.)
  • Experienced with Linux system administration.
  • Knowledge of database administration
  • A moderate allergy to manual processes

OUR ENGINEERING VALUES:

  • We believe that ideas are more important than technologies.
  • We understand that the tools we build have real-world consequences for millions of people and take that responsibility seriously.
  • Security is at the center of everything we do. We are always on the lookout for ways to further harden our platform.
  • We know that code isn't just a set of instructions for machines, but communication with other humans; style, elegance, and respect are important.
  • We believe that an ability to balance paying off technical debt and rapidly completing a project contributes to the health of the codebase, engineering team, and organization.
  • We believe that being correct isn't enough; respect for your colleagues and users is fundamental.

Follow us on Twitter @ActBlue and our blog

LOCATION AND COMPENSATION

ActBlue's headquarters are located in Davis Square in Somerville, MA, just a few blocks from Boston's MBTA Red Line train. This posting is for a full-time, in office, salaried position based in Somerville, MA, though we are open to discussion about remote work for the right candidate. We are authorized to support remote work in California, Colorado, Florida, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington DC, Washington, Wisconsin.

  • In the short term: Due to COVID-19, we have shifted our entire staff to fully remote until June 2021. ActBlue is equipped to have you onboard and begin employment remotely from your home office if you are hired for this role. If working out of our ActBlue offices in Somerville long-term will entail relocation for you, we will work with you directly to make sure you're able to relocate in a reasonable time frame once ActBlue resumes standard in-office work patterns.

We offer a competitive salary and a generous compensation package, which includes commuter benefits or home office stipend; fully paid and trans-inclusive health, dental, and vision insurance; an employer-sponsored 401k contribution plan; a generous professional development stipend; three months paid parental leave for all genders, adoptions included; and a flexible time off policy.

Women, people of color, LGBTQIA2S+ individuals, and members of other minority or marginalized groups are strongly encouraged to apply. ActBlue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against candidates on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. ActBlue cannot at this time sponsor work visas.

job.title: Adherence Navigator (Customer Service Representative)
job.body:
Position Overview

The Adherence Navigator (CSR) is part of a growing initiative at Human Care Systems supporting the improvement of patient outcomes through implementation of evidence-based patient navigation services. The Adherence Navigator (CSR) provides individualized assistance to patients to facilitate access to quality care. Often the first point of contact with the patient, this position ensures that patients are informed of potential care options. The Adherence Navigators reduce barriers that prevent patients from getting timely treatment by identifying patient needs and directing them to appropriate resources for various treatment support.


The Adherence Navigator (CSR) will report to the Adherence Navigator Manager (RN) and work alongside the Adherence Navigators (RN) to:

  • Facilitate communication between patients, caregivers, and Adherence Navigators to ensure patient satisfaction and quality of care
  • Manage and record healthcare records in Resilix™
  • Inform patients on financial aspects of care and connecting patients to financial resources as needed
  • Educate patients on general product information and program resources
  • Collaborate with diverse organizations and personnel to ensure the needs of the patient are met
  • Build working relationships, solve problems, direct patients to resources, and manage information
  • Improve coordination of patient care and reduce barriers
  • Provide information about patient navigator services

The Adherence Navigator (CSR) will have a strong interest in improving health outcomes for patients, with the ability to easily communicate with diverse patients and Adherence Navigators. Ideally, the candidate will have direct experience in primary care centers in a patient-facing role. The Adherence Navigator (CSR) will possess a customer service focus, with enthusiasm for finding solutions and resources to allow more patients to receive treatment services. The Adherence Navigator (CSR) will be a self-starter, driven by improving health outcomes and health equity, and have a strong ability to operate autonomously with minimal support.

Role Requirements

  • Excellent verbal communication skills
  • Excellent written communication skills for accurate and timely documentation.
  • Compassionate
  • Attentive to Detail
  • Organized
  • Empathetic to patient barriers
  • Respond to patient inquiries and assist patients with the completion of paperwork
  • Educate patients on care processes and provide counsel to reduce anxiety and fear
  • Identify patient barriers to treatment such as transportation, insurance, and language barriers, and refer patients to additional resources to support engagement in care
  • Attend trainings and learning opportunities that expand content knowledge and best practices
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Excellent coordination skills including multitasking and appropriately prioritizing several tasks at hand
  • Demonstrates awareness and value of cultural competence
  • Strong ability to deal with difficult situations and health care emergencies

Company Overview

Human Care Systems (HCS, www.humancaresystems.com) is the Treatment Adherence company – we design, develop, and deliver improved access, use, experience and outcomes from medicines. We deliver evidence-based smart interactions via phone, mobile, web to help patients, family and clinicians better manage barriers that could hinder initiation and adherence to therapy. Our customers are biopharmaceutical companies (large to small) seeking to improve therapy initiation and adherence. Our people are systematic doers focused on improving the patient’s experience and outcomes. They are committed to their work, the results they deliver and the learning environment in which they work. HCS was founded in 2008 by Matt Hall and Thom Doyle and is based in Boston.

The Resilix™ Platform and Adherence Navigators (RN) allow us to provide solutions in: Treatment Initiation, Adherence Programs, Patient Services Infrastructure, Omni-Channel Nurse Support, Contact Center & Field Force Platform, Patient CRM & Digital Engagement, Patient Support Programs, Product Launch Support.


Some of the advantages of working on the HCS team include:

  • Open-minded, creative, and dedicated colleagues delivering tangible patient support programs every day
  • Unlimited lateral and upward experiences, learning, and leadership opportunities.
  • We give you the freedom to achieve, grow without limits, and lead. We also offer a flexible vacation policy (coordinated with colleagues) and options for remote work (with some time per week in the office).
  • Help patients start, stay on, and achieve optimal experience and outcomes with treatment
  • Highly competitive compensation, stock options, and comprehensive benefits
  • We transform the patient experience through Adherence Navigators and powerful technology. ResilixTM is built on a cutting-edge stack (Mongo, Express, Vue.js, Node.js) + AWS + APIs + microservices architecture

PREREQUISTIES:

job.title: Head of Technical Operations
job.body:
True Brands is a fast growing creativity-driven, consumer product company specializing in the design, import, and distribution of high end beverage lifestyle products. We’ve become a major contender in the growing beverage accessories marketplace, with over 25,000 customers worldwide. Our team consists of intelligent, creative and driven individuals who love working together. Check out our website (www.truebrands.com) to learn more about our products.


We are currently seeking candidates for a Senior Technical Operations Director. This role is responsible for leveraging technology to solve problems and drive improvements to the business. In this role, you have a global understanding of all technology and process systems across the company. You will be working with every department leader to find solutions that will make us more effective and efficient as a company.


The ideal candidate is a great leader that is technically and operationally minded. Someone that is a problem-solver, resourceful, communicates effectively, and is eager to learn and grow with the company.


Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Develop and maintain an in-depth knowledge of True Brands’ business model and processes, Consult with departmental team leads to align business processes and practice continuous improvement
  • Attend executive meetings and represent IT in key decisions and strategic conversations. Provide leadership and guidance on how to best configure True Brands’ applications to support business objectives
  • Manage internal IT team, including structure, hiring, training, and performance reviews of SMEs in networking, technical operations, data analytics, and scripting. Source, contract with, and manage third party resources to fill gaps in internal knowledge and optimize ROI
  • Oversee IT department’s case management system, ensuring cases are being prioritized, assigned, and completed with the appropriate timing and quality
  • Evaluate and source new technology solutions. Collaborate with users, technical team, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software features, explain technical designs, articulate technical strategies. Define and take ownership of implementation plans utilizing internal and external resources for creative, development, testing, etc.
  • Manage and oversee the departmental budget in accordance to company financial goals
  • Oversee network development and connectivity of four locations including a remote warehouse in Indianapolis, two local event spaces, and one head office.
  • Respond to needs, questions, and training of network users concerning their access to resources on the network and the operations of various software programs
  • Create and enforce company policies for computer usage and information security


Required Qualifications:

  • Experience or education in technical operations, ERP administration, business process optimization, and/or business intelligence
  • Experience acting as a technical leader focused on building high-performance, scalable and robust systems in a complex, multi-tiered, distribution environment
  • Rapidly acquire a deep understanding of supporting applications - especially NetSuite ERP & CRM
  • Ability to effectively communicate with business users and technical resources alike, helping all parties understand technical and business juxtapositions and initiatives.
  • Ability to influence at all levels of the company while fostering and maintaining a positive attitude and IT-team culture.
  • Initiative and resourcefulness to work cross-functionally to fully understand and organize a project
  • Passion and drive for identifying and implementing business process efficiencies
  • Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
  • Commitment to building sustainable systems and a high-quality UI for our dynamic, fast-growing user-base
  • Drive to take ownership, perform well, and learn quickly
  • Capacity to manage a complex task list and quickly-changing priorities
  • Strategically-minded and able to always consider the big picture while delivering on the details
  • NetSuite, Magento, or Domo experience
  • JavaScript, SQL, html, and/or advanced Excel skills
  • Cloud computing optimization experience
  • Knowledge of agile software development practices
