job.title: Senior Software Engineer - Go
job.body:
Title: Senior Software Engineer - Go


Location: This is a fully remote position. If you are located near one of our rewardStyle, come have a coffee when you want to socialize!


Your Role:


Join the LIKEtoKNOW.it team! We are looking for you, a talented and passionate developer looking to tackle challenging features and interesting problems at large scale. You'll work with a team of highly motivated and fast moving professionals focused on continuing to grow ourselves, our innovative apps and our products.

Want to see what it is like inside rewardStyle HQ?
https://youtu.be/U39GQ0f7UMI


What You'll Do..


  • Work on features that get delivered to market as soon as complete
  • Learn new technologies and growing your skills.
  • Deploying your own code.
  • Scale new and existing systems.
  • Participate in the design, development and testing of SaaS and Mobile applications
  • Partnering with engineering teams in both Dallas and NY
  • Identify and drive improvements to our software and development processes
  • Design and implement highly scalable and maintainable offerings
  • Work and succeed in a fast-paced agile development environment
  • Communicate technical decisions to non-technical audiences and build consensus around them
  • Drive tasks to completion and owning entire projects.
  • Work with a range of databases and data pipelines.
  • Evaluate new technologies.
  • Be a technical expert and helping raise up the teams you are on.

What we're looking for..


  • 4+ years of backend software development in SAAS or mobile technologies
  • Ability to communicate and interact on a team with empathy and understanding.
  • Deep knowledge of multiple database systems.
  • Extensive experience writing backend systems with languages such as Golang, Python, or Node.js.
  • Experience designing systems that involve Big Data.
  • Experience with developing and deploying to public clouds.

What would set you apart..but is not required.


  • Experience with GOLANG is preferred.
  • Experience integrating 3rd party API's (REST, OAuth, JSONP)
  • Contributor to open source projects.
  • Experience with docker and container orchestration.
  • Experience working with AWS knowledge.

What's in it for you?


  • Fully stocked bars and kitchen (free snacks all day!)
  • Catered meals weekly
  • Interesting problems to solve
  • Chair massages
  • Competitive comp and benefits including 401K
  • Laid back office environment
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Disrupting the retail industry!

_______________________________________________________________________


About us


Since 2011, rewardStyle has fueled the arrival of a new influence on the retail industry: professional content creators. By providing the innovative technologies, strategic growth consultancy and partnerships necessary to empower a global network of 40,000 premium lifestyle content creators and 4,500 retailers, rewardStyle is making a tangible impact on global e-commerce sales. In 2017 alone, rewardStyle Influencers drove more than $1 billion in online retail sales to our brand partners.


LIKEtoKNOW.it, rewardStyle's consumer-facing shopping platform which makes thousands of pieces of original influencer content actionable each day for millions of consumers worldwide, was launched in 2014. In March 2017, the game-changing LIKEtoKNOW.it app was launched, featuring a proprietary technology that allows consumers to instantly shop their screenshots of influencer-created imagery anywhere they discover it across social media and the mobile web. Only 9 months after launching, the LIKEtoKNOW.it app hit 1 million registered users, outpacing the launch-year user acquisition rate of some of today's most popular content discovery apps.


Honored as one of the 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World by Fast Company, rewardStyle has redirected the lifestyle publishing industry and contributed to the professionalization and financial independence of thousands of influencers worldwide, enabling them to earn meaningful revenue on their digital content and ultimately empowering them to grow their small businesses into internationally-recognized brands.


rewardStyle's Engineering team is made up of talented software developers and customer-focused individuals who are passionate about tackling complex and interesting problems at large scale and continuously delivering innovative products and features.Today, #rStheFamily has 250+ team members working from rewardStyle offices in Dallas, London, New York, Shanghai, São Paulo, Los Angeles, and Berlin.


____


We are not offering sponsorships opportunities at this time for persons requiring employment visas, such as an H-1B; authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.


Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of rewardStyle are considered property of rewardStyle and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

job.title: Engineering Team Lead
job.body:
*It is expected that the person in the role will work close to US Pacific time hours during their normal workday.*

About us:

Wiser is the leading provider of actionable data for better decisions. Wiser collects and analyzes online and in-store data with unmatched speed, scale and accuracy. The Wiser platform then blends these insights with advanced workflow software to drive business value for brands and retailers. Using a unique combination of data science and human validation, Wiser offers integrated solutions for every aspect of retail, all in one place.


Essential Functions:

Our goal is to solve a messy problem elegantly and cost effectively. Our job is to collect, match, categorize, and analyze data on 20+ million products from the websites of all the largest retailers and marketplaces in the world. We help our customers be more competitive and make more money by discovering interesting patterns in this data they can use to their advantage.

We are looking for a hands-on Engineering Manager and technical lead to drive execution and innovation within the team that develops our proprietary website extraction technology. If you love working on really hard problems, mentoring sharp engineers, and writing clean code, you will love this role. The right leader will have a passion for optimization, scaling, and big data.


Responsibilities:

  • Think like our customers – you will be the engineering thought leader and partner for the product owner responsible for our online data collection platform
  • Mentor and lead – you will drive excellence in software craftsmanship within the team, as well as growing and stretching them to higher levels of achievement
  • Write a lot of code – our coaches still play the game, so you’ll be in the code with your team delivering on our product roadmap
  • Improve the quality of our solutions – you will hold yourself and your team members accountable to high quality standards
  • Own the mission – you are driven to win, to build product that you are proud of, to deliver the solutions that truly solve our customer needs
  • Bring new ideas to the table – some of our best innovations originate within the team


Technologies we use:

  • JavaScript, Node.js, Java, Python, ReactJS, TypeScript
  • AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform
  • RabbitMQ, Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, ELK, Event Sourcing

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of professional software engineering experience, with at least 2 years leading/managing a software team
  • Proficiency with architecting and delivering solutions within a distributed software platform
  • Solid understanding of AWS, Linux, K8s and infrastructure concepts
  • Strong RDBMS & SQL programming experience
  • Proven ability to learn quickly, make pragmatic decisions, and adapt to changing business needs
  • Proven ability to work and effectively, prioritize and organize your work and the work of team members in a highly dynamic environment
  • Track record of lifting and challenging teammates to higher levels of achievement
  • Focus on results: shipping software that matters to the company and the customer

  • Experience overcoming the difficulties of managing projects with remote and global team members
  • Ability to maintain regular and reliable work attendance
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills. Should be able to adapt communication style to suit different audiences.


Bonus Points:

  • Domain Driven Design
  • Passion for data, analytics
  • Experience working within a retail or ecommerce environment


Supervisory Responsibility:

  • Directly manage a distributed team of 4-6 people
  • Hiring top-quality engineers onto the team as-needed
  • Mentoring and growing team members into more senior roles
  • Setting goals, gathering feedback, and delivering performance reviews as part of Wiser’s career management process

job.title: Senior Developer
job.body:
Nexant touches the customer experience from multiple perspectives as a globally recognized software, consulting, and services leader. We work to solve problems and help utilities, energy enterprises, and government agencies worldwide. Founded in 2000, Nexant provides dynamic solutions to improve customer engagement, boost operational efficiency, reduce costs for customers and utilities, and save resources.

  • Every day, we partner with our customers to reimagine the world we live in and how we can work together to drive a more productive and sustainable energy future.
  • We develop innovative software, provide consulting and energy services, and deliver award-winning outcomes to utilities, energy enterprises, and government partners. We strive to provide a digital customer experience that increases productivity and leads the way to a better tomorrow.

Nexant is currently seeking highly skilled developers experienced with building complex business applications using the Laravel, Vue and the Tailwind CSS frameworks for our Utility Services Business Unit. This full-time position will be working with our team in Madison, WI, ideally within the office or remote. This person will be responsible for supporting the development of software tools used to facilitate and enable the delivery of energy efficiency programs. This position will work on a wide range of software tools to fundamentally change how utilities deliver energy efficiency programs to their customers.

Requirements

  • Working within an agile and TDD process to build both the front and back ends of the services and software that our team provides to aid in energy efficiency programs.
  • Maintain quality control of all deliverable products, demonstrating excellence and objectivity while maintaining both budgets and schedules defined by others which include
    • Passionate about writing clean and maintainable code with good test coverage, while balancing sticking with what works and exploring new ways of doing things
    • Implementation of new features in collaboration with other teams within Nexant
    • Optimization of existing code for performance, maintainability, extensibility and flexibility
    • Consideration about the developer’s experience in code written
    • Document your development process and features
  • Provide ongoing support, feedback, and collaboration for existing software applications by serving as a technical contact and lead for internal questions and customer questions.
  • Mentor and assist team members with development, testing and implementation of features and functionality through common software development processes such as:
    • Code review of colleague’s work
    • Stand up meetings
    • Technical requirement gathering
    • Pair Programming
    • Team training meetings to encourage continued growth for everyone
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Hands-on software development experience in designing and developing high performance, reliable and scalable production systems
  • 4-5+ years of experience with working professionally with PHP and OOP
  • 4-5+ years of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development
  • 4-5+ years of experience with MySQL, Access, or other relational databases
  • 3+ years of experience working with Laravel or Symfony
  • 2+ years of working with Vue or React
  • Experience with test driven development
  • Experience with server administration and AWS is a plus
  • Experience with Node/Deno JS is a plus
  • Familiar with developing RESTful webservices and ORM concepts
  • Experience tuning applications for performance and scalability
  • OAuth and JWT Tokens experience is a plus
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in the English language
  • Self motivated and self-disciplined with getting things done
  • Practical Knowledge of the Agile Software Development Life cycle and working with tools such as Git and Jira
  • Knowledge of Utility Industry and related software systems is ideal
  • B.S. or M.S in Computer Science or related experience

Benefits

Salary and Benefits (U.S.)

Nexant offers competitive salaries based on candidate's qualifications. Nexant also offers three weeks paid vacation per year, eleven paid holidays per year, a 401(k) plan with employee matching funds and an overall comprehensive benefits package.

About Nexant

Every day, Nexant employees partner with customers to reimagine the world we live in and create a more sustainable energy future.

Nexant is a premier provider of technology enabled solutions to the Utility and Energy Industry focused on the next generation intelligent grid, distributed energy resources, and the digital customer experience. Operating from 20 offices around the world, the company's team of industry professionals has completed more than 5,000 engagements in over 70 countries. Nexant's clients include over 200 utility and software services customers. We work with over 300 chemical and petroleum majors, financial institutions, and Fortune 500 companies. Find out more at www.nexant.com.

Nexant supports clients through the following business units:

  • Utility Software and Services: We deliver software-enabled strategy, consulting, and implementation services. Software has developed and commercialized a number of industry-leading software platforms and applications including iEnergy®, Grid360™, and iHedge®. Utility Services works with clients to drive customer energy savings; ensure cost-effective program design, implementation, management, and evaluation; and promote customer engagement.
  • Energy & Chemicals Advisory: We offer consulting services, subscriptions, and training. E&CA provides strategic planning, project development, competitor analysis, and market and price forecasting.


Diversity & Sustainability at Nexant

At Nexant, diversity, equality, and inclusion matter. We have made a firm commitment to address diversity in every aspect of our business operations. We recognize that to be successful, it is vital to celebrate our differences, provide fair opportunity, and learn from one another.

The management of energy, water and other vital resources is in a pivotal moment in history. We believe we have an opportunity to empower sustainable activities as a business and as individuals. This belief is infused in our relationships with employees, clients, our supply chain, and the environment. We are proud of our sustainability achievements as a company and how our business aligns with the goal of a resourceful, responsible, and sustainable world. Nexant has been recording, reporting, and offsetting our North American office carbon emissions with The Climate Registry since 2008. Nexant is a member of EUISSCA, an alliance of US electric utilities and their suppliers that was formed to promote a robust and sustainable electric utility industry supply chain.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.body:
Packetized Energy is seeking a talented, highly motivated individual to join our team as a Senior Software Engineer. Our patented energy management algorithms offer a unique solution to the $100 billion annual market for energy flexibility. We are unique

  • in our cost (less than half the cost of competing approaches)
  • in our scalability (packets of information scale the internet, packets of energy can scale energy flexibility)
  • in our commitment to privacy and autonomy (unlike our competitors, our approach to energy management is bottom up, data-light and focused on quality of service to the end user)

Energy flexibility is a market that is not just valuable but a crucial component of the transition to a clean energy economy. This is a job for folks who want to do something meaningful for climate change.

Requirements

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Delivering high quality code daily
  • Designing scalable cloud-based architectures within the AWS ecosystem
  • Working closely with our product team and customers to understand requirements
  • Ensuring that we always have people’s comfort, privacy and security at the forefront of our design
  • Staying on top of technical innovation in computer science, distributed systems, security, energy and IoT technologies
  • Evaluating whether and when to incorporate new technologies into our stack
  • Providing guidance to other engineers on the team through code reviews, pair coding and mentorship

Qualifications:
  • 4+ years in software development
  • Proficient in modern server-side frameworks such as Node.js/Express
  • Proficient in modern front-end frameworks such as React.js
  • 2+ years working with cloud-native tools in AWS: Lambda, DynamoDB, SNS, SQS, ECS, etc.
  • Strong communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to self-motivate and problem solve
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly pick up domain expertise

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2+ years working with Node.js
  • 2+ years working with React.js
  • Prior startup experience
  • Demonstrated ability to set goals and deliver results in a complex domain

Packetized Energy values diversity and inclusion and we encourage applicants from groups underrepresented in the tech industry. We consider candidates holistically, so go ahead and apply even if you’re not sure you meet all the requirements. Packetized Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Benefits

Benefits include stock options, health care, a retirement savings plan, and the opportunity to work with a team of amazing people who are passionate about solving energy problems. We have a flexible working environment:

  • Work remotely from anywhere within the US
  • If you're in the Burlington, VT area, you have the option of working out of our main office at Chase Mill in Burlington, VT, just across the river from Winooski
  • If you're in the Boston, MA area, you have the option of working out of our office at Greentown Labs located near Union Square in Somerville, MA

This position is open as a 3-month 1099 contract arrangement, with a possibility of extension. Ideally this position will be based in either Dallas, Austin, or Colorado Springs, but we are also open to 100% remote (note: candidates must be US based for remote work).

**Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.**


Who we are: At Hypergiant, our work is driven by individuals pushing the boundary and always professionally challenging our clients to think differently. We're seeking individuals who are both analytical and creative and can help us fuel our motto: Tomorrowing Today. We're based in Texas and have a strong track record of working with some of the biggest brands around the world in industries spanning retail, oil & gas, energy, aviation, healthcare, and more. We provide large enterprises with cutting-edge advice, bespoke technology solutions, and deployment expertise needed to harness the value out of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our goal is to work with forward-thinking organizations and to help them understand how Artificial Intelligence will affect their business and their industry.

We are looking for a Lead Engineer who can build and maintain web apps and open-source libraries that can be shared across projects. This position will work alongside a dedicated project team on highly complex DoD projects.

You will write high-quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate; collaborate with developers, designers, testers, project managers, product managers, and project sponsors; communicate tasking estimation and progress regularly to a project manager through appropriate tools; and work in an Agile-like, iterative development process.

  • Ability to manage client expectations and project timelines.
  • Able to write organized, accessible, and performant apps using JavaScript, advanced CSS, and HTML.
  • Experience with CSS in JS solutions such as Styled Components or Emotion.
  • Ability to architect complex and performant React applications; solid understanding of application architecture, and concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6.
  • Ability to make effective architecture decisions if necessary.
  • Ability to manage robust testing & workflow automations (Jest, Rollup, Webpack, Babel).
  • Ability to quickly fix bugs and solve problems in large, complex apps.
  • Familiarity with creating custom visualizations using D3 or similar SVG libraries.

Preferred Experience

  • Experience auditing third party dependencies in React ecosystem preferred.
  • Experience with single page application CI/CD.
  • Back-end development experience is considered a plus.
  • A portfolio of past projects with code samples or GitHub links.

Hypergiant, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We offer a fun, flexible work environment, company-sponsored activities, and commit to providing each employee with job satisfaction by addressing core needs. Learn more at hypergiant.com.

Have you ever wanted to work in a role that directly impacts the music industry? Are you seeking a role that advances creative growth? Are you interested in contributing to a team that develops business solutions that benefit independent artists and music companies alike? Then join us at SoundExchange, where we have the privilege of serving the entire creative music community!

At SoundExchange, we have developed a cloud-based enterprise software platform to support our rapidly growing and evolving business. Our software platform is a set of cloud-native, federated systems that are highly scalable, resilient, and modular, leveraging both custom-built and 3rd party components. We are seeking individuals to become members of our growing Engineering team to help evolve SoundExchange’s software strategy and products and expand our service offerings to the music industry.

We’re hiring Lead Software Engineers that will be key contributors to the full lifecycle of our software development process while coaching, leading, and mentoring their teams. You will lead and direct the work of others and assist in the direction of the engineering organization by developing, releasing, integrating, maintaining, and supporting software applications and systems according to business needs. You will also be a hands-on lead developer that excels in a dynamic, fast-moving, and agile environment and is passionate about developing high quality, scalable software. You will be familiar with a variety of enterprise software engineering concepts, models, practices, and processes. You will rely on your considerable experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. This exciting role will allow you a wide degree of creativity and latitude.

With your help, we will continue to collect and distribute digital performance royalties on behalf of more than 200,000 recording artists’ and master rights owners’ accounts and administer direct agreements on behalf of rights owners and licensees. We will also work together to build and enhance the additional services (particularly for music publishing) that SoundExchange provides to the entire music industry.

job.title: Web Development Instructor
job.body:
Fullstack Academy is a top-ranked immersive school for web development and cybersecurity training based in New York City. Fullstack offers comprehensive in-person and remote training opportunities across the U.S. and prepares students with the in-demand skills they need to launch fulfilling tech careers.

"Fullstack Academy has been a life-changing experience" is something we hear often and the reason why we come to work everyday. We’re looking for a Web Development Instructor who can help us transform the lives of our students, and through them, their communities and economies by inspiring, mentoring and encouraging a new generation of Software Engineers.


ABOUT THE ROLE

As an Instructor for Fullstack Academy’s flagship Web Development bootcamp program, you lead instruction for our core bootcamp program. You’ll deliver lectures and support students through exercises designed to embed key web development concepts. You’ll guide students through the development of stellar projects. You’ll facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community. You’ll collaborate with our dedicated support and administrative staff to ensure an exceptional experience for each student in our program..

This is a full-time role, based in New York City and reports to the Director - New York Campus.


RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role, you will

  • Lead instruction on Web Development and other technology topics, through whole-class lectures, activity-based learning workshops, code reviews, office hours, mock technical interviews, and project-based experiential learning
  • Work with students 1-on-1, in pairs and in groups to support their learning and growth in the program
  • Create a positive, professional and inclusive learning environment and culture for our students
  • Create lesson plans, lecture materials, assessments, and supplemental workshops based on our award-winning curriculum
  • Keep up to date on relevant trends in the web development field


QUALIFICATIONS:

You are a great candidate if you have:

  • The experience and/or credentials that satisfy New York State regulatory requirements for a software engineering instructor - either:
    • A BA/BS in Computer Science; or
    • A BA/BS in any subject, including 12 college credits in STEM content areas, plus 1 year of professional Software Engineering experience
  • 1+ years of experience working as a professional Software Engineer
  • Professional proficiency with the core technologies of fullstack JavaScript development: Node.js, PostgreSQL, HTML/CSS, React
  • Professional proficiency with current Web Development best practices (Agile/Git workflows, client-side development database design, fullstack architecture, etc.)
  • 1 year of experience teaching, tutoring, or mentoring on fullstack Software Engineering concepts
  • Exceptional and engaging presentation skills - particularly when it comes to complex technical information
  • The ability to distill complex technical topics into beginner-friendly concepts
  • A desire to work in a fast-moving environment with a high degree of ownership and independence
  • A love of software development and a passion for growing the careers of a diverse new generation of software engineering professionals

About Us:


Risk Based Security (https://www.riskbasedsecurity.com/) is one of Richmond’s fastest growing and most innovative cyber security organizations. As winner of the 2019 Emerging Technology Business Award, presented by the Richmond Technology Council and the 2015, Product Innovation Award, presented by the Virginia Chamber of Commerce, RBS has a solid track record of excellence in the cyber security industry. Our products, Cyber Risk Analytics (CRA) and VulnDB, provide organizations access to the most comprehensive threat and vulnerability intelligence and organizational risk ratings available. In addition, our YourCISO offering provides organizations with on-demand access to high quality security and information risk management resources in one easy to use web portal. We celebrated our 8th Anniversary in 2019 with the opening of our new office in Scott’s Addition.


About The Role:


We are looking for a senior level experienced developer. Our HQs is located in Richmond, VA and we prefer a local candidate. However, we are willing to make an exception for the right candidate! Applicants should possess the qualities of a maintainer, innovator, and leader.


Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Maintain and evolve our customer facing applications as well as our backend tools that support the company built in Ruby using Ruby on Rails framework.
  • Work with founders to understand the product vision, define requirements, create roadmaps and implement.
  • Write beautiful, efficient, and secure code that you are proud of and is showcase worthy (modern, sleek) and participate in code reviews.
  • Work to upgrade legacy code and refactor as required.
  • Assist with debugging / development of bug fixes - day-to-day maintenance and work with our support team.
  • Function as “product manager” helping to managing requirements, feature requests, schedule releases, as well as long-term support.
  • Provide quality assurance of work on new and existing projects.
  • Liaison and manage our outsourced development partners.
  • Provide on-call support if any issues or outages occur.
  • Minimal travel may be required.

Required Experience:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related, required. Master’s Degree, Preferred in CS or Information Technology or related.
  • You are able to build high-quality, test-driven, Ruby on Rails Applications.
  • You have an excellent understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. (Bonus points if you have experience with a frontend framework like React or Angular)
  • You love ActiveRecord but aren’t afraid to write raw SQL, when you need to (and you know when you need to).
  • You have a knowledge of debugging, design patterns, refactoring, and methodologies such as object-oriented and functional, as they pertain to Ruby.
  • Good understanding of secure coding principles.
  • Familiarity with co-development environments and source control, like GIT and using Github.
  • Experience operating a Linux-based server in the cloud.
  • Ability to work constructively with team members and service providers.
  • Experience integrating 3rd party APIs and obtaining data.
  • Experience creating robust RESTful APIs.
  • Strong attention to design detail.
  • Strong communication skills.

Preferred Experience:


  • Have a deep experience in Ruby on Rails.
  • Ability to sees things from a user’s point of view and figure out the best system flow and design to implement requirements.
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Experience with architecting systems and automating deployment with tools such as Chef and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with Bootstrap, Elasticsearch, jQuery, Postgres, MySQL, Redmine, Redis, Sendgrid, Sinatra.
  • Experience maintaining information security.
  • Experience working remotely.
  • Experience leading teams.

To be considered for this position, applicants should be able to provide examples on their resume and portfolio that demonstrate their passion for programming, Github, or other information highlighting recent work and abilities.


Benefits:


  • Competitive Compensation with emerging technology companies.
  • Eligible for yearly bonus based on individual and company performance.
  • Six Paid Company Holidays and Vacation pay.
  • Company paid Disability and Life Benefits.
  • Eligible for Simple IRA.
  • Security training and conference attendance.
  • This is a full time position.

job.title: Senior Digital Producer
job.body:
Senior Digital Producer (Full-Time / Los Angeles, CA)

ROSEWOOD is looking for a Senior Digital Producer to help us oversee the development and successful execution of all interactive projects - from websites, to app development, and digital immersive experiences. ROSEWOOD is excited to partner with someone who brings best-in-class digital production techniques, has their eye on the latest technology, and truly understands how consumers engage with brands in digital landscapes.

The Senior Digital Producer will lead efforts on multiple accounts across a variety of projects. This role is fast-paced and requires superb communication, ongoing collaboration, and a can-do attitude. The Senior Digital Producer will report directly to the Executive Producer.

This role will start out remotely and will eventually be based in our Los Angeles office.

Responsibilities

  • Oversee the development and successful execution of all interactive projects, varying in size from large to small scale projects, and from websites, to app development, and digital immersive experiences.
  • Approach every project with a clear purpose and ensure all executions meet business and client partner goals.
  • Create intricate project plans that consider every detail and budget line item.
  • Bring in, diversify, and expand the agency’s best-in-class vendor partners.
  • Lead multi-disciplinary teams, anticipating potential project risks, identifying solutions to solve them, and ensuring the teams’ workflow is developing as planned.
  • The Senior Digital Producer is able to manage many moving parts and complex workflows, identifying resource needs for projects, prioritize tasks, ensure the team meets deadlines, keep teams organized, and regularly communicates with EP and VP of Production on the status of projects, escalating issues as needed.
  • Oversees and manages 1-2 direct reports. The Senior Digital Producer understands the needs of both a client and internal team sides of things and is able to effectively communicate with both parties.

Requirements

  • 5-7 years experience in digital production, with experience working across multiple capabilities and mediums
  • Demonstrate a well-rounded background in current social and online technologies.
  • Ability to coordinate Agile production approaches, anticipate distant and day to day needs, while maintaining high-level oversight.
  • Familiar with building sites in WordPress, Squarepace, as well as from scratch, and an understanding of various coding languages (e.g. HTML+, JS and CSS).
  • Ability to balance business needs versus technical constraints
  • Experience and comfortable being client-facing as needed
  • Ability to conduct in-depth quality assurance on both creative materials and technology functionality.
  • Experience overseeing multiple projects and maintaining a high level of attention to detail to ensure compliance with project requirements.
  • Video Production and Post Production experience a plus
  • UX/UI strategy/design experience a plus
  • Team player with a positive, solution-oriented attitude
  • Strategic thinker with strong time management skills who's able to prioritize tasks and address the most critical and pressing demands first.
  • Strong written and verbal communication with the ability to guide as a decision-maker
  • Inspired to push creative boundaries through technology
  • Extraordinary leadership and organizational skills
  • Geeks out about the latest technology, trends, and digital campaigns
  • Willingness to adapt to the needs of the team
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment

Benefits

  • Paid Vacation
  • Sick Time
  • Paid Holidays
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Company matching 401K
  • Cell phone and Wellness Reimbursements
  • This organization participates in e-Verify.

Senior Site Reliability Engineer (Remote)

Pear Deck is an Ed Tech startup headquartered in Iowa City, Iowa, with remote team members around the country. We're driven by a mission to help teachers deliver powerful learning moments to every student, every day.

We are building a team of individuals who value inclusion, work according to our core values of truth, brilliance, humility, and determination, and are excited to apply their talents to creating something meaningful together. If you like the idea of being part of a mission-driven company working on big problems in education, join us!

We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to make accommodations.

As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer you will contribute to Pear Deck's mission by helping us focus our expectations around availability, correctness, and performance while building tools and sharing expertise with the team to ensure our service continues to meet expectations as it scales. The work will cover a wide area, from directly improving our core services to oncall and incident analysis, education around scaling and resilience, and feedback into the product itself.

Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate truth, humility, brilliance, and determination in their work
  • Demand Forecasting and Capacity planning for continued and/or improved site reliability
  • Implement and provision necessary infrastructure changes for continued and/or improved site reliability

  • Monitor health of production infrastructure and investigate/analyse any issues and abnormalities to identify problems or bottlenecks
  • Communicate uptime and quality of service issues effectively
  • On call rotations and incident response during off-hours
  • Implement and deploy hotfixes as necessary
  • Plan, track and perform routine system maintenance and software updates to infrastructure
  • Track and document reliability related issues and incidents
  • Mapping business goals to architectural/infrastructure decisions

  • Experience operating Kubernetes clusters
  • Experience in large-scale cloud environments
  • Excellent troubleshooting/debugging skills
  • Willingness to learn about, work with and understand existing systems
  • Comfortable with a Blameless Post-Mortem Culture.
  • Ability to remain calm and collected under pressure
  • Significant experience with the following technologies:

  • Experience with the following or related technologies is a plus:
    • Terraform
    • Python
    • Prometheus
    • MongoDB
    • Redis
    • Firebase Realtime Database
    • BigQuery

Benefits:

  • 401K with company match
  • Health, Dental, Vision Insurance

job.title: Senior Graphic Designer
job.body:
BrainPOP is an online K-12 educational solution that makes rigorous learning experiences accessible and engaging for all. Proven to raise academic achievement, BrainPOP has been a trusted resource to more than six million educators, and engages the hearts and challenged the minds of over 300 million learners worldwide.

BrainPOP provides endless opportunities for kids to take agency over their learning through playful, knowledge-building content and learner-driven projects, preparing them for success in the classroom and beyond.

We’re seeking a Senior Graphic Designer to join our growing Marketing and Brand team.

In this role you will:

  • Ideate and translate concepts into solid design for marketing campaigns and beyond
  • Create design systems and create digital branding and marketing campaigns
  • Design and develop original pieces, including illustrations and infographics
  • Maintain brand consistency throughout all our marketing projects
  • Translate ideas and concepts into thoughtful and engaging solutions
  • Collaborate with marketing and design teams
  • Shape deliverables across various touchpoints and channels
  • Be a champion for all creative work, helping those around us understand why what we do is invaluable
  • Contribute to positive work culture within your team and outside of it.
  • Coordinate design with copy to bring a variety of collateral to life

You Are:

  • Able to work methodically and meet deadlines
  • Detail-oriented and have a passion for your craft
  • A consistent and relentless self-starter who takes initiative and welcomes feedback and collaboration.
  • Excited about the opportunity to help shape creative design in EdTech and understands the responsibility that comes with it.
  • Someone who understands the difference between decoration and design and is a strategic thinker.
  • Flexible and open-minded during project changes and works well with other departments
  • Knowledgeable of best practices for all environments of design, including websites, emails, social media, and UX/UI.
  • A champion for all creative work, helping those around us understand why what we do is invaluable

On Your Resume:

  • Experience working on 360 degree campaigns, from the planning to the execution stage
  • Experience in branding, creating design system and digital branding and marketing campaigns
  • Experience as in-house designer or at a marketing agency.
  • 4+ years of Branding/Visual Design experience
  • Experience working on 360 campaigns
  • Proficient in InDesign, Illustrator, and Sketch (is sketch necessary?)
  • A strong background in digital design, email, landing pages, and social media
  • Experience in these tools is a big plus:
    • Jira
    • Google Suite
    • Social content experience
    • Photoshop
    • Animation Experience (for social media)
    • Miro
    • Abstract
    • HTML and Javascript

Life at BrainPOP

Our commitment to supporting and empowering teachers and students is reflected in our dedication to enhancing the lives of our employees—in and out of the office.

Our team is made up of educators, data scientists, published authors, engineers, artists, bakers, film buffs, cyclists, dual-citizens, and so much more. We value Diversity & Inclusion, collaboration and learning from multiple perspectives, and encourage people to bring their most authentic selves to work.

Besides offering a comprehensive benefits package and putting an emphasis on work-life balance, we make it a point to integrate fun and play into the workplace.

What we do today directly impacts how teachers teach, and students learn. We continue to be inspired because we can see the difference we’re making and we’re proud to be a creative, collaborative, always-teaching and always-learning community.

Due to COVID-19, all BrainPOP employees will be working remotely through April 2021.

We believe that a diverse organization is a more effective organization. BrainPOP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.body:
About Pushnami

Named the #1 Fastest-Growing Company in Central Texas | Austin Business Journal

Pushnami, a leading digital marketing software provider based in Austin, is seeking a talented Senior Development Engineer to join our growing team. The company offers its clients unparalleled performance through machine learning enabled messaging solutions. Pushnami builds technologies on the forefront of the latest online notification technologies. The system currently delivers over 300 million unique messages per day and is live on more than 10,000 enterprise websites globally.

About the Senior Development Engineer Role

You will be an important part of our DevOps team to create improvements and cutting-edge solutions for Pushnami Admin app, API, data bases, machine learning, and more.

Your responsibilities will include working closely with our product design team to help build innovative solutions. You will primarily program in Angular, Node JS, and NoSQL Database (MongoDB, Cassandra, InfluxDB or similar). You will also contribute to improving Pushnami operations and infrastructure.

Requirements

  • Are excited about joining a fast-growing and profitable startup.
  • Enjoy rapid development environments. We push code multiple times per day.
  • Have 4+ years of prior experience in roles that include front-end and back-end development.
  • Are fluent in Javascript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Have advanced experience with NoSQL databases.
  • 3+ years experience using MongoDB
  • 2+ years experience using Node.js
  • Had a chance to work with large volumes of data.
  • Have worked in an environment where developers have written tests and shared ownership of code.

Benefits

What you'll love about us:

  • We are self-funded and profitable (and growing fast)
  • We were named one of Inc Magazine’s 2020 Best Place to Work & Builtin Austin’s 2020 Best Places to Work in Austin, Best Perks & Benefits, and Best Paying List.
  • Lots of room for growth – we empower our people then get out of their way
  • Fun – we're passionate and enjoy what we do
  • Empathy - we care about our employees and our customers


Pushnami Employment Benefits:

  • A competitive base salary plus bonuses
  • Full Medical and Dental PPO Insurance that is 100% paid for by the company
  • 401k Retirement Plan - Fully matched up to 6%
  • Flexible work schedule that is based on performance rather than time
  • Unlimited paid vacation after one year of employment
  • Relaxed dress code and open office environment
  • Full stocked break room, breakfast taco Tuesday, catered lunches Monday - Thursday
  • A supportive culture that encourages health and personal improvement

Pushnami was built on the principles of positivity and acceptance. We strive to build an inclusive work environment that uses our success to make a genuine impact on the community around us. No employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status.

_________________________________________________________________
*HOW ARE WE NAVIGATING WORK DURING COVID?*
While we would love to have everyone back in the office, employee health and safety is our top priority.

Our team will continue to conduct employee well-being check-ins, provide additional remote perks and benefits and allow all employees to work virtually for the remainder of 2020.

job.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
job.body:
Company: The mission of Well (https://www.well.co/) is to create massive impact and affect change to healthcare through a differentiated consumer experience and a world-class data and analytics engine to drive engagement and behavior change. The product - a consumer health engagement platform - integrates layers of analytics, digital, concierge services, behavioral health, telemedicine, care management and wellness services to drive sustained engagement, lower costs and improve the health of users. A key differentiator to drive Well's success is a highly diverse, engaged organization whose employees are passionate about the mission of the company and whose management is passionate about the employees.

What makes WELL unique:

We are working with and looking for new technologies that will give us an edge. If you have a curious mind, enjoy creating new solutions to problems, and want to work with the latest technology and immediately see the contributions you've made to the project, this is the place for you. What you do matters. Here at Well, you can see the efforts of your work in our end product. We have a casual, flexible informal work environment. You'll have an intro into your area of focus and have the ability to jump right in and begin to work. You'll be able to take pride in your work; your contributions will be seen quickly through our sprint development life cycle. We are a diverse, engaged organization whose employees are passionate about the mission of the company and whose management is passionate about the employees.

Reporting To: Senior Director of Cloud Architecture

Description:

As a key member of our Dev and Cloud Ops Software Engineering team, your primary mission will be to enable the business to achieve all of its goals by implementing a wide array of innovative cloud native infrastructure for development, data, product, and AI platforms to ensure that we can operationally support our customers through first-class products. The infrastructure and platforms must meet the security requirements of a HIPAA / HITECH / HITRUST environment and leverage modern cloud technologies and services. This position is normally based onsite in our Technology hub of Minneapolis, MN but will be remote for the near to intermediate term due to COVID. We will also consider candidates located in one of our other geographic hubs: New York City, Boston or Chapel Hill, NC.

Key Responsibilities:

  • In collaboration with the DevOps team lead and principal architect, and working with a dynamic team of two DevOps engineers, build out and maintain secure enterprise wide cloud environments that deliver the necessary business functionality for all internal and external stakeholders
  • Support hundreds of services and data stores in a microservice architecture, automating and operationalize all aspects of cloud environment creation and maintenance
  • Collaborate with key engineering, operational, and business stakeholders to build from scratch these secure cloud services in an innovative way, utilizing modern technologies and services emphasizing containerization, serverless, and streaming technologies.
  • Collaborate with current team members, including the team lead/principal architect, delivery manager, security engineering, and others to enable secure, stable, and well maintained set of cloud environments to enable complex web and mobile properties
  • Get stuff done
  • Work with the team lead to break high level requirements down into manageable tasks for yourself and others
  • Support all cloud engineering activities, including CI/CD tooling build out, serverless framework selection, data storage architecture and technologies, automated testing frameworks, development best practices, and debugging and application monitoring solutions
  • Experiment and develop novel solutions to complex problems
  • Meet all development practices and influence information security best practices to ensure all compliance requirements are met
  • Follow all IT policies and make recommendations to improve such policies to ensure an agile and innovative culture
  • Ensure all proper monitoring and redundancy is in place to ensure the reliability required by the business and its products utilizing modern SaaS based solutions
  • Perform analysis on incidents and quality of service to improve all facets of support over time
  • Stay abreast of innovative and new cloud and service technologies and solutions to reduce overhead, cost, and maintenance
  • Take personal responsibility for keeping all Well systems and data, including sensitive member data, secure and safe, according to Well data and security policies and HIPAA guidelines

Qualifications:

  • Eligible to work in the U.S.
  • 5+ years of Dev or Cloud Ops engineering experience
  • Proven experience in cloud infrastructure tools such as Terraform
  • Credibility from a technology perspective, including recent projects, solutions, and build out examples
  • Experience in event driven and distributed services
  • Knowledgeable in at least one modern public cloud offering (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Experience in cloud programming languages such as JavaScript or Golang
  • Familiarity with industry leading cloud technologies such as DynamoDB, BigQuery, Lambda, Terraform, API Gateway, and Kinesis
  • Experience with using open source libraries to expedite delivery of an application
  • Work using agile methodologies and open to exploring new ways to ensure rapid delivery of features in a secure and robust manner; ability to participate in individual sprints and iterations
  • Experience in high security cloud infrastructure preferred
  • An innovative mindset
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentations for all levels of management
  • Experience in/ability to navigate a venture-backed startup
  • Demonstrated collaborative style, with the ability to influence diverse teams and build strong relationships across various internal stakeholders and constituents

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering or science, or equivalent experience

Well is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: Director, Software Engineering (Backend Technologies)
job.body:
Our mission is simple: To help employees and their organizations thrive. How do we do that? We facilitate the ongoing conversation between employees and their company to drive success. We are passionate about helping organizations listen to and act on what matters most to employees. When employees are happy, everyone is happy! We love working closely with our clients, listening to their vision, and deploying a tailored solution to empower them to grow. Perceptyx’s approach to employee engagement is unique. Our combination of technology and expertise is second to none. We employ an incredible staff of professionals with the experience, knowledge, and drive to move every employee survey project swiftly from vision to reality. https://perceptyx.com/

Job Purpose: The chosen Director, Software Engineering for backend technologies will be responsible for providing strong technology leadership, presence, and direction for our backend engineering functions to support our strategic initiatives within Perceptyx’ global business. The Director will also be responsible for helping set and maintain our backend engineering systems and standards necessary to keep Perceptyx competitive in the marketplace. In addition, the Director will be responsible to provide stable engineering leadership and direction for the strategic engineering initiatives and product development within Perceptyx business. The Director will oversee the day-to-day design and development of our software and data platform and ensure our engineering teams use industry-leading technology capabilities when building products. Perceptyx will task the Director with gathering and anticipating future architectural requirements and identifying changes needed to Perceptyx’s technology stack to support future requirements. The Director will also partner with product management, quality assurance, and infrastructure teams to continuously evolve the platform to ensure future needs are met.

The Director, Software Engineering (backend technologies), will partner with key organization leadership to provide a strategic approach to our backend systems and architecture; creating high performing applications, enhancing stability, scale, quality, and design processes and metrics that enable the organization to meet its objectives. The Director will manage, build and develop a team of backend engineers, establish and continuously improve Perceptyx software standards and practices, processes, and procedures in support of the strategic direction for a multi-channel web-based, high transaction volume, consumer-facing, and B2B service-oriented organization.

In addition to the technical responsibilities, the Director's key strategic responsibility will be to lead and mentor a team of high-performing engineers and establish a go forward platform. The ability to develop and manage key partnerships will be critical to the Director's success and will be a crucial responsibility.

*** The chosen candidate will need to be within driving distance to Temecula, CA and/or Orange County, CA area ***

What You Will Do:

  • Responsible for defining, designing, and maintaining Perceptyx backend systems.
  • Responsible for all aspects of design, development, and deployment of software projects in support of product development.
  • Ability to offer strategic guidance on software and platform solutions, architectures, integration strategies, governance, and business support processes.
  • Integrate disparate teams with diverse practices, technology, and toolsets into a cohesive, standards-based, and aligned development organization.
  • Participate actively in developing and executing an engineering roadmap to increase business capabilities, improve software stability, and reduce time and cost of delivery. Also, help establish engineering practices around instrumentation, unit testing, and telemetry to support our product roadmap considering external trends and competitive advances.
  • Define and deploy transformational technology capabilities.
  • Maintain service levels and execute on continuous improvement of the existing systems while consistently ensuring quality deliverables.
  • Influence and implement change strategies that will improve end-to-end technology projects' execution to reduce cost, improve quality, and gain efficiencies.
  • Accountability for all aspects of software engineering practices (not limited to scalability and performance), of design, development, and launching on both on-prem and cloud-based applications and sites.
  • Provide technology vision and leadership and cultivate a culture of empowerment and accountability.
  • Lead, coach, motivate, and lead team members and organizations to help reach their optimum performance levels.
  • Continuous improvement in the software development lifecycle.
  • Provide communications management to ensure timely and appropriate generation, collection, dissemination, storage, and disposition of essential performance KPI’s.
  • Metrics analysis: Identify, capture, analysis and improvement of key indicators of success, and leveraging these to improve speed to market.

Requirements

WhatYou Will Bring:

  • BSc in Information Business, Technology, computer science, relevant field; Master’s degree preferred
  • 10 years in a leadership role including experience leading a team, setting priorities and plans to meet business goals and objectives
  • 15+ years of relevant software engineer/data engineering experience within diverse industries and leadership experience in product development required
  • Broad experience building, leading, managing and mentoring high-performance Agile-based engineering teams
  • Demonstrated success in building and maintaining relationships with internal stakeholders
  • Experience defining and implementing unit testing frame works, instrumentation, cloud agnostic applications
  • Previous experience implementing relational and NoSQL solutions (MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)
  • Experience in:
    • SaaS software engineering
    • High transaction system
    • Software – standards, instrumentation, telemetry, and quality
    • Experience managing teams with varied development stacks – Go, Python, node.js, and Pearl is a plus
    • Implementing domain-based architecture – API, Microservices, etc.
    • Docker experience a must; Kubernetes is an added plus
    • Cloud based processing – AWS or Azure
  • Must be able to operate independently with limited supervision
  • Must be able to advocate effectively for risk reductions and operational improvements
  • Must have deep experience in vendor product evaluation.
  • Willingness to work with people from diverse backgrounds and experiences
  • Ability to develop and manage service levels

Benefits

What We Offer:

  • Excellent Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits for you and your family
  • The ability to think and act like an Entrepreneur in a greenfield opportunity
  • Flexible work from home schedules (before, during, AND after Covid-19)
  • An engaging work environment that is named as one of the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies for the 5th year in a row!

Perceptyx Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:

We celebrate diversity and an inclusive environment. Perceptyx is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Perceptyx’ policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. All aspects of employment are decided on the basis of qualifications, competence, merit and business needs. Perceptyx is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Interested in interviewing? Please apply by responding with your updated resume

Health Axis Group, a leader in healthcare technology, is searching for a Sr. OBIEE Administrator/ Architect to join our Data Solutions team here in Tampa, FL. This position is responsible for working with the Business Intelligence (BI) team members, business analysts, and other BI developers, subject matter experts and business stakeholders to deliver reporting and analytics solutions within the data warehouse.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Regularly communicate one’s progress, problems and plans to leadership; adapt to changes in the project plan.

  • Expertise in configuring LDAP, SSL Firewall and SSO (Single Sign-on)
  • Experience in implementing Security Model for Dashboard, Role, Object and Row level.
  • Expertise in configuring Interactive Dashboards with drill-drown capabilities using global and local filters
  • Expertise in Security setup and Administration in RPD and Catalog
